hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת הַכֹּהֲנִים שׁוֹמְרִים בְּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ: בֵּית אַבְטִינָס, בֵּית הַנִּיצוֹץ, בֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד. בְּבֵית אַבְטִינָס וּבְבֵית הַנִּיצוֹץ הָיוּ עֲלִיּוֹת, הָרוֹבִים שׁוֹמְרִים שָׁם.
human_translation: The priests keep watch in three places in the Temple In the Chamber of Avtinas, and In the Chamber of the Spark, and in the Chamber of the Hearth, In the Chamber of Avtinas and in the Chamber of the Spark there were upper stories, the young keep watch there.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In three places the priests would keep watch in the Temple: Beit Avtinas, Beit Hanitzotz, Beit Hamoked. In Beit Avtinas and Beit Hanitzotz there were chambers, most of the priests would keep watch there.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד כִּיפָּה, וּבַיִת הַגָּדוֹל הָיָה, מוּקָּף רוֹבְדִין שֶׁל אֶבֶן. זִקְנֵי בֵּית אָב יְשֵׁנִים שָׁם וּמַפְתְּחוֹת הָעֲזָרָה בְּיָדָם.

llm_translation: House of the hearth was like a dome, and the great house was surrounded by a row of stones. The elders of the father's house slept there, and the keys of the Temple courtyard were in their hands.

llm_translation: One who wants to donate to the altar, he rises early and immerses until the appointed one does not come. And at what hour does the appointed one come? Not all times are equal, sometimes he comes from the outskirts of the city, or near him, either before or after him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְהַחֹנִים לִפְנֵי הַמִּשְׁכָּן קֵדְמָה לִפְנֵי אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד מִזְרָחָה מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו שֹׁמְרִים מִשְׁמֶרֶת הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לְמִשְׁמֶרֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״.

However, the Mishnah teaches: In three places the Kohanim guard in the Temple, and the Leviim in twenty-one places. And regarding the verse, 'Kohanim and Leviim side by side,' it is written!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״וְהַחֹנִים לִפְנֵי הַמִּשְׁכָּן קֵדְמָה לִפְנֵי אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד מִזְרָחָה מֹשֶׁה וַהֲדַר אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו שֹׁמְרֵי מִשְׁמֶרֶת הַמִּקְדָּשׁ״. אַהֲרֹן – בְּחַד מָקוֹם, וּבָנָיו – בִּשְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד כִּיפָּה, וּבַיִת גָּדוֹל הָיָה.

hebrew_text: וְחַד שׁוֹמֵר הוּא דַּהֲוָה בְּבֵית הַמּוֹקֵד? וּרְמִינְהִי: שְׁנֵי שְׁעָרִים הָיוּ בְּבֵית הַמּוֹקֵד, אֶחָד פָּתוּחַ לַחֵיל, וְאֶחָד פָּתוּחַ לָעֲזָרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בָּזֶה שֶׁנִּכְנָסִין לָעֲזָרָה – פִּשְׁפָּשׁ קָטָן הָיָה לוֹ, שֶׁבּוֹ נִכְנָסִין לִבְלוֹשׁ הָעֲזָרָה! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּגַבֵּי הֲדָדֵי הֲווֹ קָיְימִי – סַגִּי לְהוּ בְּחַד שׁוֹמֵר, דָּוֵי לְהָכָא וְדָוֵי לְהָכָא.

And raises a contradiction The Chamber of the Hearth had two gates; one, open to the rampart, and one, open to the courtyard. llm_translation: Encircling a row of stones. What is the row of stones? A decree of a stone that was removed from its place to another place. And were they perhaps arguing about stones? And it is written: "And the house, when it was built, was built of whole stone, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דִּמְתַקְּנִי וּמַיְיתִי מֵעִיקָּרָא אַבְנֵי זוּטְרָתָא וְאַבְנֵי רַבְרְבָתָא, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״אַבְנֵי עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת וְאַבְנֵי שְׁמֹנֶה אַמּוֹת״.
human_translation: Abaye said: as prepared And initially brought small stones and large stones as it is written: stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits”
llm_translation: Abaye said: I will repair and bring from the outset small stones and large stones, as it is written: "stones of ten cubits and stones of eight cubits."

hebrew_text: זִקְנֵי בֵּית אָב יְשֵׁנִים שָׁם. וְאַמַּאי? לְעַיְּילִי מִטּוֹת! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְעַיּוֹלֵי מִטּוֹת לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: the elders of the patrilineal family sleep there, But why Let them bring beds Abaye said: not proper conduct to bring beds into the Temple.
llm_translation: Elders of the house of the father are there. And why? To bring in beds! Abaye said: It is not the way of the world to bring in beds to the Temple.

hebrew_text: פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה, אִישׁ כְּסוּתוֹ בָּאָרֶץ. אַמַּאי הָתָם קָרֵי לְהוּ ״רוֹבִים״, הָכָא קָרֵי לְהוּ
human_translation: young men of the priesthood, each his garment on the ground. Why there, calls them young rovim here, calls them
llm_translation: Flowers of the priesthood, each man his garment in the land. Why there is it called "Robim," here it is called to them.

hebrew_text: ״פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה״? אָמְרִי: אִין, הָתָם, דְּלָא מָטוּ לְמֶעְבַּד עֲבוֹדָה – קָרֵי לְהוּ ״רוֹבִים״, הָכָא, דְּמָטוּ לְהוּ לְמֶעְבַּד עֲבוֹדָה – קָרֵי לְהוּ ״פִּרְחֵי״.
human_translation: young men of the priesthood [ pirḥei khehunna ]? say: Yes, There, who have not reached to perform service, calls them young Here, who have reached they to perform service, calls them young men
llm_translation: "Talmudic text: 'Pirchei Kehunah'? They said: No, there, because they did not come to perform the service - it is called 'rovim,' here, because they came to perform the service - it is called 'pirchei.'"

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת הַכֹּהֲנִים שׁוֹמְרִים בְּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ: בְּבֵית אַבְטִינָס, וּבְבֵית הַנִּיצוֹץ, וּבְבֵית הַמּוֹקֵד.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere The priests keep watch in three places in the Temple In the Chamber of Avtinas, and in the Chamber of the Spark, and in the Chamber of the Hearth.
llm_translation: We learned there: In three places the priests keep watch in the Temple: in Beit Avtinas, and in Beit Hanitzotz, and in Beit Hamoked.

hebrew_text: וְהַלְוִיִּם בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד מְקוֹמוֹת: חֲמִשָּׁה – עַל חֲמִשָּׁה שַׁעֲרֵי הַר הַבַּיִת. אַרְבָּעָה – עַל אַרְבַּע פִּנּוֹתָיו מִבִּפְנִים. חֲמִשָּׁה – עַל חֲמִשָּׁה שַׁעֲרֵי עֲזָרָה. וְאַרְבָּעָה – עַל אַרְבַּע פִּנּוֹתָיו מִבַּחוּץ. אֶחָד – בְּלִשְׁכַּת הַקׇּרְבָּן, וְאֶחָד – בְּלִשְׁכַּת הַפָּרוֹכֶת, וְאֶחָד – אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכַּפּוֹרֶת.
human_translation: And the Levites in twenty-one places, Five upon five gates of the Temple Mount; four upon four corners of within five upon five gates of courtyard, and four upon four corners of outside One in the Chamber of the Offering, one in the Chamber of the Curtain, and one behind the Chamber of the Ark Cover,
llm_translation: Levites in twenty-one places: five - on the five gates of the Temple Mount. Four - on its four corners from within. Five - on the five gates of the Azarah. And four - on its four corners from outside. One - in the Chamber of the Offering, and one - in the Chamber of the Veil, and one - behind the Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה מִסּוּרָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״לַמִּזְרָח הַלְוִיִּם שִׁשָּׁה לַצָּפוֹנָה לְוִיִּם אַרְבָּעָה לַנֶּגְבָּה לְוִיִּם אַרְבָּעָה וְלָאֲסֻפִּים שְׁנַיִם שְׁנָיִם לַפַּרְבָּר לַמַּעֲרָב אַרְבָּעָה לַמְסִלָּה שְׁנַיִם לַפַּרְבָּר״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda of Sura said, and some say it was taught in a baraita : as it is written Eastward were six Levites, northward four Levites, southward four Levites, and for the Asuppim two and two. For the Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at the Parbar
llm_translation: "From where are these words?" Rav Yehudah said from Sura, and some say he said it in a baraita: as it is written, "To the east, Levites six, to the north Levites four, to the south Levites four, and to the Asuppim two, two to Parbar, to the west four, to the Shallecheth two to Parbar."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָנֵי עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה הָווּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: לָאֲסֻפִּים – שְׁנַיִם (שְׁנַיִם).
human_translation: say these are twenty-four Abaye said: This is saying: “For the Asuppim two.
llm_translation: They said: "Those twenty-four were!" Abaye said, thus he said: "For gatherings - two (two)."

hebrew_text: אַכַּתִּי, עֶשְׂרִין וּתְרֵי הָווּ! הַיְאךְ דְּפַרְבָּר – חַד הֲוָה, וְאַחֲרִינָא, בְּצַוְותָּא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב גַּבֵּיהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאֵי אַבָּרַאי.
human_translation: there are still twenty-two That which Parbar , was one and the other it was as company that he went and sat with due to that was situated on the outer
llm_translation: אַכַּתִּי, עֶשְׂרִין וּתְרֵי הָווּ! הַיְאךְ דְּפַרְבָּר – חַד הֲוָה, וְאַחֲרִינָא, בְּצַוְותָּא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב גַּבֵּיהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאֵי אַבָּרַאי. "Indeed, twenty and two were they! How was it with Parbar - one was it, and another, in the commandments he would go and sit upon it - because he was standing on the other side."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לַפַּרְבָּר״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כְּלַפֵּי בַּר״.
human_translation: What “at the Parbar [ laParbar ]” Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: like one who says: Toward the outside [ kelapei bar ].
llm_translation: What is "laparbar"? Rabba bar Rav Sheilah said: Like the one who says "k'lapei bar."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה, כְּדִכְתִיב. תְּלָתָא מִינַּיְיהוּ – דְּכֹהֲנִים, וְעֶשְׂרִין וְחַד – דִּלְוִיִּם.
human_translation: And if you wish, say actually twenty-four as it is written. Three of them by priests, and twenty-one by Levites.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always twenty and four, as it is written. Three from them - of the Kohanim, and twenty and one - of the Levites.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, לְוִיִּם הוּא דִּכְתִיב! כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מְקוֹמוֹת נִקְרְאוּ כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם, וְזֶה אֶחָד מֵהֶן – ״וְהַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם בְּנֵי צָדוֹק״.
human_translation: But isn’t it written here Levites? in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In twenty-four places priests are called Levites, and this is one of them: “But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok,
llm_translation: And here, it is regarding Levites, as it is written! Like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In twenty-four places were Kohanim called Levites, and this is one of them - "And the Kohanim, the Levites, the sons of Zadok."

hebrew_text: חֲמִשָּׁה – עַל חֲמִשָּׁה שַׁעֲרֵי הַר הַבַּיִת, וְאַרְבָּעָה – עַל אַרְבָּעָה פִּנּוֹתָיו מִתּוֹכוֹ. חֲמִשָּׁה – עַל חֲמִשָּׁה שַׁעֲרֵי עֲזָרָה, וְאַרְבָּעָה – עַל אַרְבָּעָה פִּנּוֹתָיו מִבַּחוּץ. מַאי שְׁנָא הַר הַבַּיִת דְּעָבְדִינַן מִתּוֹכוֹ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא עֲזָרָה דְּעָבְדִינַן מִבַּחוּץ?
human_translation: five upon five gates of the Temple Mount, and four upon four corners of within Five upon five gates of courtyard, and four upon four corners of outside What is different the Temple Mount that we perform within and what is different courtyard that we perform outside
llm_translation: Five - on five gates of the Temple Mount, and four - on its four corners from within. Five - on five gates of the Temple Courtyard, and four - on its four corners from outside. What is the difference between the Temple Mount that we serve from within, and the Courtyard that we serve from outside?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הַר הַבַּיִת, דְּאִי תָּמַהּ וּבָעֵי מֵיתַב – יָתֵיב, אָמְרִינַן מִתּוֹכוֹ. עֲזָרָה, דְּאִי תָּמַהּ וּבָעֵי לְמֵיתַב – לָא מָצֵי יָתֵיב, דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵין יְשִׁיבָה בָּעֲזָרָה אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי בֵית דָּוִד בִּלְבַד, אָמְרִינַן מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: say: the Temple Mount, if tires and wants sit he may sit we say within courtyard, if tires and wants to sit he may not sit as the Master said: Sitting in the courtyard permitted only for kings of the house of David. we say outside
llm_translation: They said: The Temple Mount, for if one is astonished and needs to sit - he may sit, we say from within. The Temple Courtyard, for if one is astonished and needs to sit - he cannot sit, for the Master said: "There is no sitting in the Temple Courtyard except for the kings of the House of David alone," we say from outside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: חֲמִשָּׁה עַל חֲמִשָּׁה שַׁעֲרֵי עֲזָרָה. וַחֲמִשָּׁה שְׁעָרִים הוּא דְּהָוֵי בַּעֲזָרָה?! וּרְמִינְהִי שִׁבְעָה שְׁעָרִים הָיוּ בָּעֲזָרָה, שְׁלֹשָׁה בַּצָּפוֹן, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בַּדָּרוֹם, וְאֶחָד בַּמִּזְרָח!
human_translation: The Master said five upon five gates of courtyard. But was it five gates that were in the the courtyard? And raises a contradiction There were seven gates in the courtyard: Three in the north, and three in the south, and one in the east.
llm_translation: Master said: Five upon five gates of the Temple courtyard. And five gates, it is that are in the courtyard?! And raise a contradiction: There were seven gates in the courtyard, three in the north, and three in the south, and one in the east!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּרֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ לָא צְרִיכִי שִׁימּוּר. רָבָא אָמַר: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר גִּזְבָּרִין וּמִשִּׁבְעָה אֲמַרְכָּלִין. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר גִּזְבָּרִין, כְּנֶגֶד שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר שְׁעָרִים. דַּל חַמְשָׁה דְּהַר הַבַּיִת – פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תְּמָנְיָא דַּעֲזָרָה. אַלְמָא, אִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר תְּמָנְיָא הָווּ, וְאִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר שִׁבְעָה, וְאִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר חַמְשָׁה הָווּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: two of them, did not require a watch Rava said: is tanna’im , as it is taught There must be no fewer than thirteen treasurers and seven trustees Rabbi Natan says: There must be no fewer than thirteen treasurers, corresponding to thirteen gates. Remove five of the Temple Mount, there remain eight to the courtyard. Evidently, there is a tanna who said there were eight and there is a tanna who said seven and there is a tanna who said there were five
llm_translation: Abaye said: I do not need to be concerned about two types of unclean animals. Rava said: It is a Mishnaic teaching, as it was taught: There are not less than thirteen treasury chambers and seven overseers. Rabbi Natan says: There are not less than thirteen treasury chambers, corresponding to the thirteen gates. The poor of the five of the Temple Mount – they would distribute to them the eighteenth of the Azarah. This implies that there is a Tanna who said they were eighteen, and there is a Tanna who said seven, and there is a Tanna who said five.

hebrew_text: לֹא הָיוּ יְשֵׁנִים בְּבִגְדֵי קֹדֶשׁ כּוּ׳. שֵׁינָה הוּא דְּלָא, אֲבָל הִילּוּךְ – מְהַלְּכִים. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן!
human_translation: would not sleep in the sacred vestments; it is sleep that is not But walking, they may walk You may conclude from it is permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments.
llm_translation: They were not sleeping in holy garments. Sleep it is that not, but walking - walking. You heard from it: the priestly garments were given to derive benefit from them!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ הִילּוּךְ נָמֵי לָא, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי לֹא הָיוּ יְשֵׁנִים – מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא סֵיפָא: אֶלָּא פּוֹשְׁטִין וּמְקַפְּלִין וּמַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶן, קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא נָמֵי: לֹא הָיוּ יְשֵׁנִים.
human_translation: say The same is true as even walking is not and that teaches would not sleep due to that wanted to teach the latter clause: Rather, they remove and fold and they place them beneath their heads. teaches the former clause as well would not sleep
llm_translation: They said: The same applies even if they did not walk, and that which it teaches they were not sleeping - because it needs to teach the latter part: rather, they spread out and fold and place them under their heads, the former part teaches: they were not sleeping.

hebrew_text: וְהָא גּוּפַהּ קָא קַשְׁיָא: וּמַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶן – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶם! אֵימָא: נֶגֶד רָאשֵׁיהֶם.
human_translation: But itself is difficult, And they place beneath their heads, conclude from it is permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments. Say next to their heads,
llm_translation: And this itself is difficult: And we place them beneath their heads - infer from it that priestly garments were given to them to benefit from them! Say: Opposite their heads.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: תְּפִילִּין מִן הַצַּד – שַׁרְיָין, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן דִּלְמָא מִיגַּנְדַּר וְנָפֵיל עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: conclude from phylacteries by the side they are a permitted And we are not concerned perhaps he will roll over and fall upon them,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, hear from it: phylacteries from the side - permissible, and we are not concerned that perhaps they will fall and be trampled upon.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לֹא זֶהוּ אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט זֶהוּ אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כִּלְאַיִם בַּעֲלִיָּה וּלְבִישָׁה הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל מֵימַךְ תּוּתֵיהּ שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״ – אֲבָל אַתָּה מַצִּיעוֹ תַּחְתֶּיךָ. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, שֶׁמָּא תִּיכָּרֵךְ נִימָא אַחַת עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ.

llm_translation: And if you will say: "Kil'ayim in wearing and dressing is what is prohibited, but from your mother its offspring is fine," and it was taught: "Do not ascend upon you" - but you may offer it beneath you. But the sages said: It is forbidden to do so, lest one recognize a single thread on his flesh.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּמַפְסֵיק מִידֵּי, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל מִשּׁוּם קְהָלָא קַדִּישָׁא שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: אֲפִילּוּ עֶשֶׂר מַצָּעוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ, וְכִלְאַיִם תַּחְתֵּיהֶן – אָסוּר לִישַׁן עֲלֵיהֶן. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, נֶגֶד רָאשֵׁיהֶן.
human_translation: And if you would say that something separates Doesn’t Rabbi Shimon say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul says in the name of the holy community in Jerusalem: Even ten mattresses one atop the other and diverse kinds beneath them, it is prohibited to sleep upon them? Rather, conclude from next to their heads.
llm_translation: And if you will say that it interrupts the flow of blood immediately, but didn't Rabbi Shimon say, in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul from the holy congregation of Jerusalem: Even if there are ten mattresses, one on top of the other, and pillows beneath them - it is forbidden to sleep on them. Rather, learn from it, opposite their heads.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּאוֹתָן שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן כִּלְאַיִם. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה קָשִׁין הֵן, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָא נַמְטָא גַּמְדָּא דְּנַרֶשׁ – שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say to those that do not contain diverse kinds. Rav Ashi says: priestly vestments, are stiff, As Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, said: This stiff felt [ namta ], in Neresh is permitted.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: in those that do not have kilayim. Rav Ashe said: The garments of the priesthood are difficult, as Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: "The twisted thread of the linen" - permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה, הַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לִמְדִינָה – אָסוּר. וּבַמִּקְדָּשׁ, בֵּין בִּשְׁעַת עֲבוֹדָה וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת עֲבוֹדָה – מוּתָּר. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear priestly vestments, one who leaves in them to the country, prohibited. But in the Temple, both at the time of service and not at the time of service, permitted, as it is permitted to derive benefit from the priestly vestments. conclude from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: Priestly garments, one who goes out with them to the province - forbidden. And in the Temple, whether during the service or not during the service - permitted. Because the priestly garments were given for the purpose of deriving benefit from them. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וּבַמְּדִינָה לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בּוֹ – יוֹם הַר גְּרִיזִים, דְּלָא לְמִיסְפַּד, כִּדְאִיתָא בְּיוֹמָא פֶּרֶק ״בָּא לוֹ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל קָרוֹב וְכוּ׳״?!
human_translation: And not in the country, But isn’t it taught On the twenty-first of the day of Mount Gerizim, which not to eulogize. as it is in Yoma chapter, The High Priest came close
llm_translation: And in the province not? And it was taught: On the twenty-first in it - the day of Mount Gerizim, for not eulogizing, as it was stated in the chapter of the day, "When the High Priest's relative comes, etc."

hebrew_text: עַד אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רְאוּיִין הֵן לְבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה.

llm_translation: Until when should I say? They are fitting for the priestly garments.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say “It is time to act for the Lord; they have nullified Your Torah”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah."

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: מְחִילּוֹת לֹא נִתְקַדְּשׁוּ. בַּעַל קֶרִי מִשְׁתַּלֵּחַ חוּץ לִשְׁנֵי מַחֲנוֹת.

hebrew_text: וְהַנֵּרוֹת דּוֹלְקִין מִכָּאן וּמִכָּאן כּוּ׳. רַב סָפְרָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, אֲתָא רַבִּי אַבָּא נְחַר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵיעוּל מָר!

llm_translation: The lamps are lit from here and from here. Rav Safra was sitting in the bathroom, Rabbi Abba came and warmed him. He said to him: Master, you are causing harm!

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּנָפֵיק, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: עַד כָּאן לָא סְלֵיקְתְּ לְשֵׂעִיר, גְּמַרְתְּ מִילֵּי דְּשֵׂעִיר?! לָאו הָכִי תְּנַן: מְצָאוֹ נָעוּל – בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם אָדָם! לְמֵימְרָא דְּלָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמֵיעַל!
human_translation: When he came out, Rabbi Abba said to Until now, you have never entered Seir, you have learned the ways of Seir. Didn’t we learn this found closed, it was known that there was a person there, to say that should not enter
llm_translation: After he went out, Rabbi Abba said to him: Until here you did not ascend to the goat, you finished matters of the goat?! Is it not so that we learned: If he found it locked – it is known that there is a person there! By way of saying that he does not require it to ascend!

hebrew_text: וְרַב סָפְרָא סָבַר: דִּלְמָא מְסוּכָּן הוּא. כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עַמּוּד הַחוֹזֵר – מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי הִדְרוֹקָן, סִילוֹן הַחוֹזֵר – מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי יֵרָקוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Safra thought: Perhaps is in danger. as it was taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A column that is held back, causes a person to edema [ hidrokan ]. A stream that is held back causes a person to jaundice [ yerakon ].
llm_translation: Rav Safra holds: perhaps it is dangerous. As it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A returning pillar - brings a person to the gallows, a returning ladder - brings a person to the pit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ, וְכֵן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: חַשֵּׁיךְ, תַּקֵּין נַפְשָׁךְ, וּקְדֵים. תַּקֵּין נַפְשָׁךְ – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּרְחַק. תּוּב וְגַלִּי. כַּסִּי וְקוּם.
human_translation: Rav said to his son Ḥiyya, and likewise Rav Huna said to his son Rabba: Relieve yourself gets dark, and relieve yourself before so that will not distance yourself, Sit and uncover cover and stand up.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Ḥiyya his son, and so Rav Huna said to Rabbah his son: "Darken, prepare your soul, and be early. Prepare your soul - so that you will not be distant. Repent and reveal. Cover and arise."

hebrew_text: שְׁטוֹף וּשְׁתִי. [שְׁטוֹף] וְאַחֵית. וּכְשֶׁאַתָּה שׁוֹתֶה מַיִם – שְׁפוֹךְ מֵהֶן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ תֵּן לְתַלְמִידֶךָ.
human_translation: rinse and drink rinse and set But when you drink water, pour of the and afterward you may give to your student,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shetof u'sheti. Shetof v'acheit. Uk'she'ata shoteh mayim – shefoch mehen, v'achar kach ten le'talmidecha." English translation: "Wash and drink. Wash and rinse. And when you drink water – pour out from them, and afterwards give to your disciple."

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה אָדָם מַיִם וְיִתֵּן לְתַלְמִידוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן שָׁפַךְ מֵהֶן. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁשָּׁתָה מַיִם וְלֹא שָׁפַךְ מֵהֶן, וְנָתַן לְתַלְמִידוֹ, וְאוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד אִיסְטְנִיס הָיָה, וְלֹא רָצָה לִשְׁתּוֹת, וּמֵת בַּצָּמָא. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה אָדָם מַיִם וְיִתֵּן לְתַלְמִידוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן שָׁפַךְ מֵהֶן. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הִילְכָּךְ, הַאי תַּלְמִידָא דְּשָׁפֵיךְ קַמֵּי רַבֵּיהּ – לֵית בֵּיהּ מִשּׁוּם אַפְקִירוּתָא.
human_translation: As it is taught A person should not drink water and give to his student, unless he poured of it And an incident involving a certain who drank water and did not pour of it and he gave to his student. And that student was a delicate person [ istenis ], and he did not want to drink and he died of thirst. At that time, said: A person should not drink water and give to his student unless poured of it Rav Ashi said: Therefore, this student who pours in the presence of his teacher, are not due to disrespect [ afkiruta ].
llm_translation: As it was taught: A person should not drink water and give to his student, unless he first drinks from it. There was an incident with someone who drank water and did not first drink from it, and gave it to his student. And that student was Ishtenis, and he did not want to drink, and died of thirst. At that moment they said: A person should not drink water and give to his student, unless he first drinks from it. Rav Ashi said: Therefore, this student who poured out before his teacher - there is no merit in him for his self-sacrifice.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִילֵּי לָא תִּיפְלוֹט בְּאַפֵּי רַבָּךְ, בַּר מִקָּרָא וְדַיְיסָא, דְּכִפְתִילָה שֶׁל אֲבָר דָּמוּ.
human_translation: anything do not spit out in the presence of your teacher, except of gourd or porridge. as like bar of lead,
llm_translation: All words do not be hasty in the presence of your teacher, in matters of Scripture and Mishnah, like a wick of a limb of his father.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אִישׁ הַר הַבַּיִת הָיָה מְחַזֵּר עַל כָּל מִשְׁמָר וּמִשְׁמָר, וַאֲבוּקוֹת דּוֹלְקוֹת לְפָנָיו. וְכׇל מִשְׁמָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אִישׁ הַר הַבַּיִת
human_translation: We learned elsewhere The man [ ish ] of the Temple Mount would circulate among each and every watch post, And lit torches before him, And every watch post where not stand and the man of the Temple Mount say to him:
llm_translation: We learned there: A man of the Temple Mount would patrol all the shifts, and the torches were burning before him. And any shift that did not stand and say to him, "Man of the Temple Mount..."

hebrew_text: שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ״! – נִיכָּר שֶׁהוּא יָשֵׁן, חוֹבְטוֹ בְּמַקְלוֹ. וּרְשׁוּת הָיְתָה לוֹ לִשְׂרוֹף אֶת כְּסוּתוֹ. וְהֵם אוֹמְרִים: מָה קוֹל בָּעֲזָרָה? קוֹל בֶּן לֵוִי לוֹקֶה וּבְגָדָיו נִשְׂרָפִין, שֶׁיָּשַׁן לוֹ עַל מִשְׁמָר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: פַּעַם אַחַת מָצְאוּ אֶת אֲחִי אִמִּי יָשֵׁן, וְשָׂרְפוּ אֶת כְּסוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Peace be upon you. it was evident that he sleeping. strike him with his staff, and he had license to burn garment, And those say What is sound in the courtyard? sound of a Levite flogged and his clothing burned, as he was sleeping during watch. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Once, found my mother’s brother sleeping and they burned his garment.
llm_translation: Peace be upon you! - It is recognized that he is sleeping, they beat him with a stick. And he had permission to burn his garment. And they say: What is the sound in the Azarah? The voice of Ben Levi is heard being beaten and his garments are burned, because he slept on duty. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Once they found my mother's brother sleeping, and they burned his garment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: כִּי מָטֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּהָא מַתְנִיתָא, אָמַר הָכִי: אַשְׁרֵיהֶם לָרִאשׁוֹנִים, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עַל אוֹנֶס שֵׁינָה עוֹשִׂין דִּין. שֶׁלֹּא עַל אוֹנֶס שֵׁינָה – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: When Rabbi Yoḥanan would reach this mishna would say this: The early were praiseworthy, as they meted out judgment even in unavoidable sleep; all the more so in not unavoidable sleep.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: When Rabbi Yochanan would come across that Mishnah, he would say thus: Fortunate are the early ones, for even in a case of forced intimacy they still conduct a trial. If not in a case of forced intimacy, all the more so in a regular case.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵיזוֹ הִיא דֶּרֶךְ יְשָׁרָה שֶׁיָּבוֹר לוֹ הָאָדָם? יֶאֱהַב אֶת הַתּוֹכָחוֹת, שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁתּוֹכָחוֹת בָּעוֹלָם – נַחַת רוּחַ בָּאָה לָעוֹלָם, טוֹבָה וּבְרָכָה בָּאִין לָעוֹלָם, וְרָעָה מִסְתַּלֶּקֶת מִן הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלַמּוֹכִיחִים יִנְעָם וַעֲלֵיהֶם תָּבֹא בִּרְכַּת טוֹב״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: יַחְזִיק בֶּאֱמוּנָה יְתֵירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵינַי בְּנֶאֶמְנֵי אֶרֶץ לָשֶׁבֶת עִמָּדִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: Which is an upright path that a person should select for himself; should love admonition, for as long as admonition in the world, pleasantness comes into the world, goodness and blessing come into the world, and evil departs from the world, as it is stated: “But to those who admonish shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them” And some say: should adhere to utmost faithfulness as it is stated: “My eyes are upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with Me;
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: What is the straight path that a person should choose for himself? He should love rebukes, for as long as rebukes exist in the world - tranquility enters the world, goodness and blessing come into the world, and evil departs from the world, as it is stated: "And for those who rebuke, there will be delight, and a good blessing will come upon them." And some say: Let him hold fast to excessive faith, as it is stated: "My eyes are upon the faithful of the land, to dwell with me, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל הַמּוֹכִיחַ אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם – זוֹכֶה לְחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מוֹכִיחַ אָדָם אַחֲרַי״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁמּוֹשְׁכִין עָלָיו חוּט שֶׁל חֶסֶד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֵן יִמְצָא מִמַּחֲלִיק לָשׁוֹן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Anyone who rebukes another for the sake of Heaven is privileged to the portion of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “He that rebukes a man shall be behind Me” Moreover, extends over him a cord of grace, as it is stated “He will find more favor than he who flatters with the tongue.”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Anyone who rebukes his fellow for the sake of Heaven - he merits a portion of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "He who rebukes a person will afterward find favor." And not only that, but they draw upon him a thread of kindness, as it is stated: "Grace is found from one who speaks with smoothness."

hebrew_text: מְצָאוֹ נָעוּל יוֹדֵעַ וְכוּ׳. מִי שֶׁהוּא רוֹצֶה לִתְרוֹם אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ [וְכוּ׳]. הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: מִי שֶׁהוּא רוֹצֶה לִתְרוֹם אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – מַשְׁכִּים וְטוֹבֵל עַד שֶׁלֹּא יָבֹא הַמְמוּנֶּה. אַלְמָא לָאו בְּפַיִיס תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: יָבֹא וִיפַיֵּיס, אַלְמָא בְּפַיִיס תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא!
human_translation: found closed, he would know Whoever wants to remove from the altar This itself difficult. You said: Whoever wants to remove from the altar rises early and immerses before the appointed arrives. Evidently, the matter is not dependent upon a lottery; But afterward, teaches may come and participate in the lottery. Evidently, the matter is dependent upon a lottery.
llm_translation: He found it locked, he knows, etc. One who wishes to contribute to the altar, etc. This is a difficult matter in itself, as it is stated: One who wishes to contribute to the altar - he should rise early and immerse himself until the appointed one arrives. This implies that the matter does not depend on him. And then it teaches: Let him come and appease, indicating that the matter does depend on him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן – קוֹדֶם תַּקָּנָה. כָּאן – לְאַחַר תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. Here, before ordinance There, after ordinance.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Not difficult, here - before enactment. Here - after enactment.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה כׇּל מִי שֶׁרוֹצֶה לִתְרוֹם אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, תּוֹרֵם. בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מְרוּבִּין – רָצִין וְעוֹלִין בַּכֶּבֶשׁ, כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּתוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת – זָכָה. הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם שָׁוִין, הַמְמוּנֶּה אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: ״הַצְבִּיעוּ״.
human_translation: As we learned Initially, Whoever wants to remove from the altar removes When there are many run and ascend on the ramp Any who precedes the other within four cubits is privileged two were equal the appointed says to them: Raise fingers,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Initially, anyone who wishes to contribute to the altar may contribute. When they are numerous, they run and ascend the ramp. Whoever precedes his fellow within four cubits - he merits. If two were equal, the appointed one says to them: "Point."

hebrew_text: וּמָה הֵן מוֹצִיאִין? אַחַת אוֹ שְׁתַּיִם. וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין גּוּדָּל בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And what do they extend one or two And do not extend a thumb in the Temple,
llm_translation: And what do they bring out? One or two. And they do not bring out a large amount in the Temple.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שְׁנַיִם הָיוּ שָׁוִין, רָצִין וְעוֹלִין בַּכֶּבֶשׁ, וְדָחַף אֶחָד מֵהֶם אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וְנִשְׁבְּרָה רַגְלוֹ. וּכְשֶׁרָאוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁהָיוּ בָּאִים לִידֵי סַכָּנָה, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ תּוֹרְמִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ אֶלָּא בְּפַיִיס.
human_translation: an incident two were equal running and ascending on the ramp; and one of them shoved the other and his leg was broken. And when the court saw that were coming to danger, they instituted that would remove from the altar only by a lottery.
llm_translation: The incident was that two were equal, they ran and ascended on the ramp, and one of them pushed his fellow, and his leg was broken. And when the court saw that they were coming to danger, they decreed that the sacrificial altar should not be raised except in peace.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי לְאַחַר תַּקָּנָה, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מִי שֶׁהוּא רוֹצֶה לָבֹא וּלְפַיֵּיס – מַשְׁכִּים וְטוֹבֵל עַד שֶׁלֹּא יָבֹא הַמְמוּנֶּה.
human_translation: Rava said: this and that after the ordinance. And this is teaching: Whoever wants to come and to participate in the lottery rises early and immerses before the appointed arrives
llm_translation: Rava said: Both parties must wait until after the enactment, and thus it is taught: One who wishes to enter and appease - he should rise early and immerse until the appointed one does not come.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָטַל אֶת הַמַּפְתֵּחַ וּפָתַח אֶת הַפִּשְׁפָּשׁ, וְנִכְנַס מִבֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד לָעֲזָרָה, וְנִכְנְסוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים אַחֲרָיו, וּשְׁתֵּי אֲבוּקוֹת שֶׁל אוֹר בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: took the key and opened the wicket [ hapishpesh ] And he entered from the Chamber of the Hearth to the courtyard; and the priests entered after him, and two torches of fire in their hands,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He took the key and opened the wick, and entered from the chamber of the hearth to the Azarah, and the priests entered after him, and they held two torches of light in their hands.

hebrew_text: נֶחְלְקוּ לִשְׁתֵּי כִיתּוֹת, אֵלּוּ מְהַלְּכִין בָּאַכְסַדְרָה דֶּרֶךְ מִזְרָח, וְאֵלּוּ מְהַלְּכִין בָּאַכְסַדְרָה דֶּרֶךְ מַעֲרָב. הָיוּ בּוֹדְקִין וְהוֹלְכִים עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעִים לִמְקוֹם עוֹשֵׂה חֲבִיתִּים. הִגִּיעוּ – אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ אָמְרוּ: ״שָׁלוֹם, הַכֹּל שָׁלוֹם״. הֶעֱמִידוּ עוֹשֵׂה חֲבִיתִּים לַעֲשׂוֹת חֲבִיתִּים.
human_translation: divided into two groups; these walk along the portico direction of east, and those walk along the portico direction west. would continue inspecting until they reached the place the Preparer of the Griddle-Cake they reached these and those said well; all is well, They set the preparer of griddle-cake to prepare griddle-cake
llm_translation: They divided into two groups, these walk in the eastern direction orderly, and these walk in the western direction orderly. They would check and walk until they reach the place of making barrels. They arrived - these and these said: "Peace, everything is peaceful." They appointed the barrel maker to make barrels.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה לִתְרוֹם אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, הוּא יִתְרוֹם. וְהֵם אוֹמְרִים: הֱוֵי זָהִיר שֶׁלֹּא תִּגַּע בַּכְּלִי עַד שֶׁתְּקַדֵּשׁ יָדֶיךָ וְרַגְלֶיךָ מִן הַכִּיּוֹר. וַהֲרֵי הַמַּחְתָּה נְתוּנָה בַּמִּקְצוֹעַ בֵּין הַכֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, בְּמַעֲרָבוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ.
human_translation: who won to remove from the altar shall remove And say Be careful that you do not touch the vessel until you sanctify your hands and your feet from the Basin, The coal pan is placed in corner between the ramp and the altar, on the western of ramp.
llm_translation: One who merits to offer on the altar, he shall offer. And they say: Be careful not to touch the vessel until you sanctify your hands and feet from the laver. And behold, the incense altar is placed in the middle between the ramp and the altar, on the west side of the ramp.

hebrew_text: אֵין אָדָם נִכְנָס עִמּוֹ. וְלֹא נֵר בְּיָדוֹ, אֶלָּא מְהַלֵּךְ לְאוֹר הַמַּעֲרָכָה. לֹא הָיוּ רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ,
human_translation: No person would enter with And no lamp in his hand Rather, he would walk by the light of the arrangement would not see him,
llm_translation: A person does not enter with him. And not a candle in his hand, rather he walks to the light of the arena. They did not see him,

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין אֶת קוֹלוֹ, עַד שֶׁהָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל הָעֵץ שֶׁעָשָׂה בֶּן קָטִין מוּכְנִי לַכִּיּוֹר. וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים: הִגִּיעַ עֵת! קִידֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִן הַכִּיּוֹר, נָטַל מַחְתַּת הַכֶּסֶף וְעָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: nor could they hear the sound of his until they heard sound of the wood that ben Katin crafted a mechanism [ mukhani ] to the Basin they said The time has come. sanctified his hands and his feet from the Basin He took the silver coal pan and ascended to the top of the altar.
llm_translation: They did not hear his voice until they heard the voice of the tree that Ben Katin made ready for the altar. And they say: "The time has come!" He sanctified his hands and feet from the laver, took the silver basin, and ascended to the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: פִּינָּה אֶת הַגֶּחָלִים הֵילָךְ, חוֹתֶה אֶת הַמְאוּכָּלוֹת הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת. יָרַד הִגִּיעַ לָרִצְפָּה, הָפַךְ פָּנָיו לַצָּפוֹן, הוֹלֵךְ בְּמִזְרָחוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ כְּעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת. צָבַר אֶת הַגֶּחָלִים עַל גַּבֵּי הָרִצְפָּה רָחוֹק מִן הַכֶּבֶשׁ שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, מָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹתְנִים מוּרְאַת הָעוֹף, וְדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, וְדִישּׁוּן הַמְּנוֹרָה.
human_translation: cleared the coals to this side scooped the inner consumed. descended he reached the floor, he turned his face toward the north. He walk along the east of the ramp about ten cubits He heaped the coals upon the floor three handbreadths distant from the ramp, place where place the crop of the bird the ashes from the inner, altar, and the ashes from the Candelabrum.
llm_translation: He turned the coals to the north, he arranged the inner parts of the offering. He descended and reached the floor, turned his face to the north, walked in the east of the sheep about ten cubits. He piled the coals on the floor, distant from the sheep by three handbreadths, the place where the bird offering is placed, and the arrangement of the inner altar, and the arrangement of the menorah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי הֲווֹ אַכְסַדְרָאוֹת בָּעֲזָרָה? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין אַכְסַדְרָאוֹת בָּעֲזָרָה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תִטַּע לְךָ אֲשֵׁרָה כָּל עֵץ אֵצֶל מִזְבַּח ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״,
human_translation: And were there porticoes in the courtyard? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: From where that one may not build porticoes in the courtyard? The verse states: “You shall not plant for yourself an ashera of any kind of tree beside the altar of the Lord your God”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, and who were the Achsadraot in the Azarah? And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: From where do we know that they do not make Achsadraot in the Azarah? Scripture states: "You shall not plant for yourself an Asherah of any tree near the altar of the Lord your God."

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״לֹא תִטַּע לְךָ אֲשֵׁרָה״, ״לֹא תִטַּע לְךָ כׇּל עֵץ אֵצֶל מִזְבַּח ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּאַכְסַדְרָאוֹת שֶׁל בִּנְיָן.
human_translation: this is saying: You shall not plant for yourself an ashera , you shall not plant for yourself any kind of tree beside the altar of the Lord your God. Rav Ḥisda says: to porticoes of building
llm_translation: So he said: "Do not plant for yourself an Asherah," "Do not plant for yourself any tree near the altar of the Lord your God!" Rav Ḥisdah said: In the scaffolds of construction.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ בּוֹדְקִין וְהוֹלְכִין כּוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דַּחֲבִיתִּין הֲווֹ קְדִימִי?
human_translation: would continue inspecting to say that griddle-cake was before
llm_translation: They were examining and walking, etc. Is it to say that they were diligent?

hebrew_text: וְהַתַּנְיָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין דָּבָר קוֹדֵם לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָרַךְ עָלֶיהָ הָעֹלָה״, וְאָמַר רַבָּה: ״הָעֹלָה״, עוֹלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְהָחֵם חַמִּין לִרְבִיכָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught From where that there is nothing prior to the daily morning offering? The verse states: and he shall prepare the burnt offering upon it And Rabba says The burnt offering, burnt offering first Rav Yehuda says: to heat hot water for the parboiled
llm_translation: The Tanna teaches: From where do we derive that nothing precedes the morning Tamid offering? The verse states: "And he shall arrange upon it the burnt offering." Rabba said: "The burnt offering" - the first burnt offering! Rav Yehudah said: To heat water for your master.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you in three places.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רָאוּהוּ אֶחָיו שֶׁיָּרַד, וְהֵם רָצִים וּבָאִים. מִהֲרוּ וְקִדְּשׁוּ יְדֵיהֶם וְרַגְלֵיהֶם מִן הַכִּיּוֹר, נָטְלוּ אֶת הַמַּגְרֵפוֹת וְאֶת הַצִּינּוֹרוֹת וְעָלוּ לְרֹאשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: The brethren saw that he had descended and they run and come They made haste and sanctified their hands and their feet with the Basin, they took the shovels and the forks and ascended to the top of the altar.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If his brothers saw him descending, and they ran and came. They hurried and sanctified their hands and feet from the laver, they took the shovels and the basins and ascended to the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: הָאֵבָרִים וְהַפְּדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב – סוֹלְקִין אוֹתָן עַל צִדֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, אִם אֵין צְדָדִים מַחְזִיקִין – סוֹדְרִים אוֹתָם בַּסּוֹבֵב עַל הַכֶּבֶשׁ.
human_translation: the limbs and the fats that had not been consumed from the evening, clear them to the sides of the altar. If sides unable to hold arrange them on the ramp, opposite the surrounding ledge
llm_translation: The limbs and fats that were not inspected from the evening - they are removed to the sides of the altar, if the sides are not holding - they are tied around the ramp of the altar.

hebrew_text: הֵחֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין בָּאֵפֶר עַל גַּב תַּפּוּחַ. תַּפּוּחַ הָיָה בְּאֶמְצַע הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, פְּעָמִים שֶׁהָיוּ עָלָיו כִּשְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת כּוֹר. וּבָרְגָלִים לֹא הָיוּ מְדַשְּׁנִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא נוֹי לַמִּזְבֵּחַ. וּמִיָּמָיו
human_translation: began raising the ashes onto circular heap circular heap was in the middle of the altar. Sometimes there was as three hundred kor upon it. But during the Festivals they would not remove the ashes as were an adornment to the altar, In all the days
llm_translation: They would begin to bring up the ashes upon the top of the altar. The altar was in the middle, the times they were upon it about three hundred kor. And with feet they would not tread it, because it is beautiful to the altar. And from his days

hebrew_text: לֹא נִתְעַצֵּל הַכֹּהֵן מִלְּהוֹצִיא אֶת הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: the priest was never indolent in removing the ashes.
llm_translation: The priest did not become lazy to remove the ashes.

hebrew_text: הֵחֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין בַּגְּזִירִין לְסַדֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה. וְכִי כׇּל הָעֵצִים כְּשֵׁרִין לַמַּעֲרָכָה הֵן? כׇּל הָעֵצִים כְּשֵׁרִין לַמַּעֲרָכָה חוּץ מִשֶּׁל גֶּפֶן וְשֶׁל זַיִת. אֲבָל בְּאֵלּוּ הָיוּ רְגִילִין: בְּמֻרְבִּיּוֹת שֶׁל תְּאֵנָה, שֶׁל אֱגוֹז, וְשֶׁל עֵץ שֶׁמֶן.
human_translation: began raising logs to assemble the arrangement And is all the trees fit for the arrangement? all the trees is fit for the arrangement, except for from vine and from olive but were accustomed with these With young branches of fig of nut and of pinewood.
llm_translation: They began to bring up the beams to arrange the structure. And are all types of wood suitable for the structure? All types of wood are suitable for the structure except for grapevine and olive wood. But with these they were accustomed: with beams of fig, walnut, and olive trees.

hebrew_text: סִידֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה מִזְרָחָה, וַחֲזִיתָהּ מִזְרָחָה. וְרָאשֵׁי גְזִירִין הַפְּנִימִים הָיוּ נוֹגְעִין בַּתַּפּוּחַ. וְרֶיוַח הָיָה בֵּין הַגְּזִירִים, שֶׁהָיוּ מַצִּיתִים אֶת הָאֲלִיתָא מִשָּׁם.
human_translation: assembled the large arrangement on the eastern and its opening on the eastern and the inner end of logs would touch the circular heap And there was space between the logs, as they would ignite the kindling [ ha’alita ] from there,
llm_translation: He arranged the large formation from the east, and he faced it eastward. And the tops of the inner beams were touching the apple. And there was space between the beams, where they would ignite the uppermost part from there.

hebrew_text: בֵּרְרוּ מִשָּׁם עֲצֵי תְאֵנָה יָפִים, סִידֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה לִקְטוֹרֶת כְּנֶגֶד מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית, מָשׁוּךְ מִן הַקֶּרֶן כְּלַפֵּי צָפוֹן אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: selected from there fine fig trees, assembled the second arrangement for the incense. next to the southwestern removed from the corner toward the north four cubits.
llm_translation: Clarify from there the beautiful fig trees, arrange the arrangement a second time for the incense opposite the southwestern corner, drawn from the horn facing north four cubits.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹמֶד חָמֵשׁ סְאִין גֶּחָלִים. וּבְשַׁבָּת – בְּעוֹמֶד שְׁמוֹנֶה סְאִין גֶּחָלִים. שֶׁשָּׁם הָיוּ נוֹתְנִים שְׁנֵי בְּזִיכֵי לְבוֹנָה שֶׁל לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים. הָאֵבָרִים וְהַפְּדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא (הָיוּ) נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב, מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתָן לַמַּעֲרָכָה, וְהִצִּיתוּ שְׁתֵּי מַעֲרָכוֹת בָּאֵשׁ. יָרְדוּ וּבָאוּ לָהֶם לְלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית.
human_translation: of estimated five se’a of coals. And on Shabbat, of estimated eight se’a of coals, as there would place two bowls of frankincense that the shewbread the limbs and the fats that were not consumed from the evening, return them to the arrangement And kindled two arrangements with fire descended And they came to the Chamber of Hewn Stone,
llm_translation: In standing five se'ah of coals. And on Shabbat - in standing eight se'ah of coals. For there they would place two handfuls of frankincense of the showbread. The limbs and fats that were not consumed from the evening, they return them to the arrangement, and they kindled two arrangements with fire. They descended and came to them to the Chamber of Hewn Stone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: גּוּזְמָא. הִשְׁקוּ אֶת הַתָּמִיד בְּכוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב, אָמַר רָבָא: גּוּזְמָא.
human_translation: Rava said: an exaggeration. gave the daily offering to drink in cup of gold, Rava said: an exaggeration,
llm_translation: Rava said: Guzma. They poured the daily offering into a golden cup. Rava said: Guzma.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה לְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי, דִּבְּרוּ נְבִיאִים לְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי, דִּבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים לְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: Torah spoke exaggerated [ havai ] language, prophets spoke exaggerated language, the Sages spoke exaggerated language.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ammi: The Torah spoke in the language of the common people, the Prophets spoke in the language of the common people, the Sages spoke in the language of the common people.

hebrew_text: דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה לְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי – דִּכְתִיב: ״עָרִים גְּדֹלֹת וּבְצוּרֹת בַּשָּׁמָיִם״, בַּשָּׁמַיִם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא גּוּזְמָא.
human_translation: Torah spoke exaggerated language, as it is written: cities great and fortified up to heaven” enter your mind up to heaven? Rather, an exaggeration.
llm_translation: The Torah spoke in the language of human beings - as it is written: "Great and fortified cities in the heavens." In the heavens, is it possible in your opinion?! Rather, it is a decree.

hebrew_text: דִּבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים לְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן: תַּפּוּחַ, וְהִשְׁקוּ אֶת הַתָּמִיד בְּכוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב.
human_translation: the Sages spoke exaggerated language, this that we stated circular heap and gave the daily offering to drink in a cup of gold.
llm_translation: The sages spoke the language of the Hava'i - this that we said: "apple," and they watered the daily offering in a golden cup.

hebrew_text: דִּבְּרוּ נְבִיאִים לְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי – דִּכְתִיב: ״(וְכׇל עַם הָאָרֶץ) מְחַלְּלִים בַּחֲלִלִים וְגוֹ׳ וַתִּבָּקַע הָאָרֶץ לְקוֹלָם״.
human_translation: prophets spoke exaggerated language, as it is written piped with pipes, so that the earth rent with the sound of them”
llm_translation: The prophets spoke in the language of the common people - as it is written: "(And all the people of the land) are profaning by profanations, etc., and the land split open because of their voice."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי בַּר נַחְמָנִי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת דִּבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים בִּלְשׁוֹן הֲבַאי, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: תַּפּוּחַ, גֶּפֶן, וּפָרֹכֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai bar Naḥmani says Shmuel says: In three instances, the Sages spoke in exaggerated language, and these are those circular heap vine, and Curtain
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai bar Nachmani said, Shmuel said: In three places the Sages spoke in the language of the Hava'i, and these are they: Tapuach (apple), Gefen (vine), and Parochet (curtain).

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרָבָא, דִּתְנַן: הִשְׁקוּ אֶת הַתָּמִיד בְּכוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב, וְאָמַר רָבָא: גּוּזְמָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הָנֵי – אִין, הָתָם – לָא. אֵין עֲנִיּוּת בִּמְקוֹם עֲשִׁירוּת.
human_translation: to exclude of Rava, as we learned gave the daily offering to drink in a cup of gold, and Rava said: an exaggeration. teaches us these yes, there, not there is no poverty in a place of wealth,
llm_translation: To go out from Ravah, as we learned: They would pour the daily offering into a golden cup, and Rava said: A decree, it is heard for us: here - yes, there - no. There is no poverty in a place of wealth.

hebrew_text: תַּפּוּחַ – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. גֶּפֶן – דְּתַנְיָא: גֶּפֶן זָהָב הָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת עַל פֶּתַח הַהֵיכָל, וּמוּדְלָה עַל גַּבֵּי כְּלוֹנְסוֹת, וְכׇל מִי שֶׁמִּתְנַדֵּב עָלֶה
human_translation: circular heap that which we stated vine as it is taught A gold vine stood at the entrance to the Sanctuary, and hung upon posts. And whoever would donate leaf,
llm_translation: Apple - this that we said. Vine - as it was taught: A golden vine was standing at the entrance of the Temple, and anyone who wished to donate would bring up a leaf.

hebrew_text: אוֹ גַרְגִּיר, אוֹ אֶשְׁכּוֹל – מֵבִיא וְתוֹלֶה בָּהּ. אֲמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה, וְנִמְנוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת כֹּהֲנִים לְפַנּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: or grape, or cluster bring and hang it on Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: There was an incident and three hundred priests were enlisted to to move it,
llm_translation: Or a nut, or a cluster - one brings and hangs on it. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok said: There was an incident, and three hundred priests were appointed to face it.

hebrew_text: פָּרוֹכֶת – דִּתְנַן רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַסְּגָן: פָּרוֹכֶת עׇבְיָהּ טֶפַח, עַל שִׁבְעִים וּשְׁנַיִם נִימִין נֶאֱרֶגֶת, וְעַל כׇּל נִימָה וְנִימָה עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חוּטִין.
human_translation: Curtain, as we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon the deputy Curtain, its thickness is handbreadth. It is woven from seventy-two strands and each and every strand from twenty-four threads.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Parochet - Ditan Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel omer mi'shum Rabbi Shimon haSagan: Parochet ovya teffach, al shiv'im u'shneim nimein ne'ergeit, ve'al kol nima ve'nima esrim ve'arba'a chutin. English translation: Parochet - We learned in a Baraita: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon the Deputy: The Parochet was a cubit thick, with seventy-two threads of blue wool, and on each thread twenty-four strands.

hebrew_text: אׇרְכָּהּ אַרְבָּעִים אַמָּה, וְרׇחְבָּהּ עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה. וּמִשְּׁמוֹנִים וּשְׁתַּיִם רִיבּוֹא נַעֲשֵׂית, וּשְׁתַּיִם עוֹשִׂין בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה, וּשְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת כֹּהֲנִים מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Its length forty cubits, and its width twenty cubits, And it is made of eighty-two ten-thousands, and two are made in each and every year. And three hundred priests immerse it.
llm_translation: Its length forty cubits, and its width twenty cubits. And eighty-two myriads it was made, and two they make every year, and three hundred priests immerse it.

hebrew_text: הֵחֵלּוּ מַעֲלִין בַּגְּזִירִין לְסַדֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה [וְכוּ׳]. חוּץ מִשֶּׁל זַיִת וּמִשֶּׁל גֶּפֶן [וְכוּ׳]. הָנֵי מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דִּקְטִרִי. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: began raising logs to assemble the arrangement except for from olive and from vine. What is the reason these Rav Pappa said: due to that they have knots Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: because settlement of Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: They began to ascend with the pruning hooks to arrange the formation etc., except for the olive tree and the grapevine etc.. What is the reason for these? Rav Papa said: because of the incense. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: because of the return to the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״עַל הָעֵצִים אֲשֶׁר עַל הָאֵשׁ״ – עֵצִים הַנִּתּוֹכִים לִהְיוֹת אֵשׁ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? דּוּקְרֵי שַׁפּוּד דְּלָא קְטִרִי וְאָזְלִי מִקְּטַר מִתּוֹכוֹ!
human_translation: raises an objection upon the wood that is on the fire wood that burns completely, until becomes fire And what is that branches a skewer [ shipud ], which do not become knotted from within.
llm_translation: Challenger: "On the wood that is on the fire" - Wood that is inside to be considered fire, and what is the reason? Because it is pierced like a spit that does not emit smoke, and the smoke goes out from its inside!

hebrew_text: וְכִי כׇּל הָעֵצִים כְּשֵׁרִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה הֵן? כׇּל הָעֵצִים כְּשֵׁרִים, חוּץ מִן זַיִת וְגֶפֶן. אֲבָל בְּאֵלּוּ הָיוּ רְגִילִין: בְּמֻרְבִּיּוֹת שֶׁל תְּאֵנָה, וְשֶׁל אֱגוֹז, וְשֶׁל עֵץ שֶׁמֶן. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מוֹסִיף אַף שֶׁל מַיִישׁ, וְשֶׁל אַלּוֹן, וְשֶׁל דֶּקֶל, וְשֶׁל חָרוּב, וְשֶׁל שִׁקְמָה.
human_translation: And is all the trees fit for the arrangement? all the trees is fit for the arrangement, except for olive and vine, but were accustomed with these With young branches of fig of nut and of pinewood. Rabbi Eliezer adds also of hackberry tree, of oak, of palm of carob and of sycamore.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Are all trees fit for the arrangement? All trees are fit, except for olive and grapevine. But with these they were accustomed: with branches of fig tree, and of walnut, and of oil tree. Rabbi Eliezer adds also with branches of myrtle, and of oak, and of palm, and of carob, and of sycamore.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם דִּקְטִרִי, בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קְטִרִי מִגַּוַּאי, כֵּיוָן דִּקְטִרִי מִבָּרַאי – לָא מַיְיתִינַן. וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא קְטִרִי מִגַּוַּאי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִבָּרַאי קְטִרִי – מַיְיתִינַן.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said because they have knots, disagree with regard to this Sage, holds although are not knotted from within, since they are knotted on the outside, we do not bring And Sage, holds since are not knotted from within, even though they are knotted on the outside, we do bring
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says it is due to the incense, in this case he argues: Mar holds: Even though he did not offer incense from the innermost part, once he offers incense from the outer part - we do not bring a proof. And Mar holds: Since he did not offer incense from the innermost part, even though he offered incense from the outer part - we bring a proof.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל: דֶּקֶל מִי לֵית בֵּיהּ מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל?
human_translation: But according to the one who said because settlement of Eretz Yisrael, palm Isn’t it subject to settlement of Eretz Yisrael?
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says in the name of Yishuv of the Land of Israel: Is there not a palm tree in it because of the return to the Land of Israel?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ: תְּאֵנָה לֵית בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל?! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר? בִּתְאֵנָה דְּלָא עֲבִדָא פֵּירָא, דֶּקֶל נָמֵי – בִּדְלָא עָבֵיד פֵּירָא.
human_translation: say to you: And according to your reasoning, isn’t fig subject to settlement of Eretz Yisrael? Rather, what have you to say? to a fig that does not bear fruit. palm as well, to that does not bear fruit.
llm_translation: He said to you: And for your taste: a fig tree does not have in it the merit of the Land of Israel?! Rather, what can you say? Regarding a fig tree that does not produce fruit, the same applies to a palm tree - if it does not produce fruit.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא תְּאֵנָה דְּלָא עָבְדָא פֵּירָא? אִין, כִּדְרַחֲבָה. דְּאָמַר רַחֲבָה: מַיְיתִי תְּאֵינֵי חִיוָּרָתָא,
human_translation: But is there a fig that does not bear fruit? Yes, in accordance with of Raḥava as Raḥava said: bring white figs,
llm_translation: And who is there a fig that did not produce fruit? None, as wide as the breadth. For Rabah said: I brought figs of the white variety.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁיְיפִי לְהוּ בְּחַבְלָא דְּצַבְתָּא דִּסְרִיךְ עֲלֵיהּ בִּזְרָא, וְקָבְרִי הֵיכָא דְּמַסֵּיק יַמָּא שִׂירְטוֹן, קוֹרָה – עָבְדָא, פֵּירֵי – לָא עָבְדָא, וּתְלָת בְּרִיכֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ לָא מַחְזְקָה לְהוּ גַּמְלָא.
human_translation: and rub them with a rope of palm to which the seeds adhere, and they plant where the sea emits sediment [ sirton ]. produces a beam, does not produce fruit. And three of its branches, a bridge cannot support them.
llm_translation: And they measured for him with a rope of the length of the ship's mast, and they buried it where the sea ceases to be turbulent, a beam - he made, planks - he did not make, and three pools of water did not strengthen the camel for them.

hebrew_text: סִידֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא. חַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא הָרוּחַ מְנַשֶּׁבֶת בָּהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ מַצִּיתִין הָאֲלִיתָא מִשָּׁם.
human_translation: assembled the large arrangement What is the reason Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda: One said so that the wind would blow into it And one said so that would light from there the kindling
llm_translation: He arranged the large formation, etc. What is the reason? Rav Huna and Rav Hisda. One said: in order for the wind to blow through it, and one said: in order for the upper lights to be kindled from there.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רֶיוַח הָיָה בָּהֶן בֵּין הַגְּזִירִין, שֶׁהָיוּ מַצִּיתִין הָאֲלִיתָא מִשָּׁם. אָמַר לָךְ, מְקוֹמוֹת מְקוֹמוֹת עָבְדִי.
human_translation: raises an objection There was space between the logs, as would ignite the kindling from there. say to you fashion many spaces
llm_translation: Challenger: There was a window between the beams, from which they would ignite the uppermost lamp. He said to you, "They served in their designated places."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ רָאוּהוּ אֶחָיו
llm_translation: We will return to you, we will see him, his brothers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן הַמְמוּנֶּה בּוֹאוּ וְהָפִיסוּ: מִי הַשּׁוֹחֵט, וּמִי הַזּוֹרֵק, מִי מְדַשֵּׁן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, מִי מְדַשֵּׁן אֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה, מִי מַעֲלֶה אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ.
human_translation: The appointed said to Come and participate in the lottery who is the who slaughter and who who sprinkle who remove the ashes from the inner, altar; who remove the ashes from the Candelabrum; who take limbs up to the ramp
llm_translation: He said to them, "Those appointed, come and cast lots: who slaughters, who sprinkles, who cleanses the inner altar, who cleanses the menorah, who brings limbs to the ramp."

hebrew_text: הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל שֶׁל יָמִין, וּשְׁתֵּי הַיָּדַיִם, הָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל שֶׁל שְׂמֹאל, הֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה, וּשְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת, הַקְּרָבַיִים, וְהַסּוֹלֶת, וְהַחֲבִיתִּין וְהַיַּיִן.
human_translation: the head and the right leg and the two forelegs; the haunch, and the left leg; the breast and the cud, and the two flanks; the innards; and the fine flour and the griddle-cake and the wine
llm_translation: The head and the leg of the right, and both the hands, the shoulder and the leg of the left, the chest and the womb, and both sides, the intestines, and the flour, and the barrels and the wine.

hebrew_text: הֵפִיסוּ, זָכָה מִי שֶׁזָּכָה.
human_translation: conducted the lottery And whoever won won
llm_translation: They cast lots, he who won, won.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: צְאוּ וּרְאוּ אִם הִגִּיעַ זְמַן שְׁחִיטָה. אִם הִגִּיעַ, הָרוֹאֶה אוֹמֵר: ״בַּרְקַאי״. מַתְיָא בֶּן שְׁמוּאֵל אוֹמֵר: הֵאִיר פְּנֵי כׇּל הַמִּזְרָח עַד שֶׁהוּא בְּחֶבְרוֹן? וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הֵן״.
human_translation: said to Go out and observe if the time for slaughter arrived. If arrived, the observer says: There is light. Matya ben Shmuel says Is the entire eastern sky illuminated as far as Hebron? And says: Yes.
llm_translation: He said to them: Go out and see if the time for slaughter has arrived. If it has arrived, the observer says, "Bar Kaya." Matya ben Shmuel says: Has he illuminated the face of the entire east until he reaches Hebron? And he says, "Yes."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: צְאוּ וְהָבִיאוּ (לִי, וְהוֹצִיאוּ) טָלֶה מִלִּשְׁכַּת הַטְּלָאִים. וַהֲרֵי לִשְׁכַּת הַטְּלָאִים נְתוּנָה בְּמִקְצוֹעַ צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית. אַרְבַּע לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם: אַחַת – לִשְׁכַּת הַטְּלָאִים, וְאַחַת – לִשְׁכַּת הַחוֹתָמוֹת, וְאַחַת – לִשְׁכַּת בֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד, וְאַחַת – לִשְׁכָּה שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בָּהּ לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים.
human_translation: said to Go out and bring a lamb from the Chamber of the Lambs, And the Chamber of the Lambs is located in the northwestern corner There were four chambers there, One the Chamber of the Lambs; and one the Chamber of the Seals, and one the Chamber of the Hearth, and one the chamber in which prepared the shewbread.
llm_translation: He said to them: Go and bring (for me, and take out) a lamb from the chamber of lambs. And behold, the chamber of lambs is located in the northwestern corner. There were four chambers there: one - the chamber of lambs, one - the chamber of seals, one - the chamber of the hearth, and one - the chamber where the showbread is made.

hebrew_text: נִכְנְסוּ לְלִשְׁכַּת הַכֵּלִים, הוֹצִיאוּ מִשָּׁם תִּשְׁעִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כְּלֵי כֶסֶף וּכְלֵי זָהָב, הִשְׁקוּ אֶת הַתָּמִיד בַּכּוֹס
human_translation: entered the Chamber of the Vessels, took out from there ninety-three silver vessels and gold vessels. They gave the daily offering to drink in a cup
llm_translation: They entered the Chamber of Utensils, they brought out from there ninety-three vessels of silver and vessels of gold, they watered the continual offering in a cup.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל זָהָב. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא מְבוּקָּר מִבָּעֶרֶב – מְבַקְּרִין אוֹתוֹ לְאוֹר אֲבוּקוֹת.
human_translation: of gold. Although was examined in the evening, examine it by the light of the torches.
llm_translation: Of gold. Even though it is examined from evening - they examine it by the light of torches.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בְּדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי וּבְדִישּׁוּן הַמְּנוֹרָה, הָיוּ מַקְדִּימִין, וְאַרְבָּעָה כֵּלִים בְּיָדָם: הַטְּנִי וְהַכּוּז וּשְׁנֵי מַפְתְּחוֹת. הַטְּנִי – דּוֹמֶה לְתַרְקַב שֶׁל זָהָב מַחֲזִיק קַבַּיִים וָחֵצִי. וְהַכּוּז – דּוֹמֶה לְקִיתוֹן גָּדוֹל שֶׁל זָהָב. וּשְׁתֵּי מַפְתְּחוֹת – אֶחָד שֶׁהוּא יוֹרֵד בְּאַמַּת הַשֶּׁחִי, וְאֶחָד שֶׁהוּא פּוֹתֵחַ כֵּיוָן.
human_translation: who won of the removal of ash from the inner altar and of the removal of ash from the Candelabrum would precede and four vessels in their hands: The basket, and the jug, and two keys. The basket is similar to gold three kav [ letarkav ], holds two and a half kav . And the jug is similar to a large flask [ lekitton ] of gold. And two keys, one would lower his arm to his armpit And one which opened directly.
llm_translation: One who merited in the lottery for the incense altar and in the lottery for the menorah, they would go early, and four utensils in their hands: the shovel, the censer, and two keys. The shovel - resembling a golden spoon holding three kavim and a half. And the censer - resembling a large pitcher of gold. And the two keys - one that descends into the pit of the incense, and one that opens the wick.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ לַפִּשְׁפָּשׁ הַצְּפוֹנִי. שְׁנֵי פִּשְׁפָּשִׁין הָיוּ לוֹ לַשַּׁעַר הַגָּדוֹל, אַחַת בַּצָּפוֹן, וְאַחַת בַּדָּרוֹם. שֶׁבַּדָּרוֹם לֹא נִכְנַס בּוֹ אָדָם. עָלָיו הוּא מְפוֹרָשׁ עַל יְדֵי יְחֶזְקֵאל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי ה׳ הַשַּׁעַר הַזֶּה סָגוּר יִהְיֶה לֹא יִפָּתֵחַ וְאִישׁ אַל יָבֹא בוֹ כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בָּא בוֹ וְהָיָה סָגוּר״.
human_translation: came to the northern wicket. There were two wickets for the large gate, one in the northern and one in the southern that was in the southern no person entered. In its regard, is clarified by Ezekiel, as it is stated: And the Lord said unto me: This gate shall be shut, it shall not be opened, neither shall any man enter in by it, for the Lord, the God of Israel, has entered in by it; and it shall be shut”
llm_translation: He came to the northern gate. He had two gates to the great gate, one in the north and one in the south. In the south, no man entered. It is explained about it by Ezekiel, as it is said: "And the Lord said to me, 'This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, for the Lord, the God of Israel, has entered by it, therefore it shall be shut.'"

hebrew_text: נָטַל אֶת הַמַּפְתֵּחַ וּפָתַח אֶת הַפִּשְׁפָּשׁ, וְנִכְנַס לְהַתָּא, וּמֵהַתָּא לַהֵיכָל, עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְשַׁעַר הַגָּדוֹל. הִגִּיעַ לְשַׁעַר הַגָּדוֹל, הֶעֱבִיר אֶת הַנֶּגֶר וְאֶת הַפּוֹתְחוֹת וּפְתָחוֹ. לֹא הָיָה שׁוֹחֵט הַשּׁוֹחֵט עַד שֶׁשּׁוֹמֵעַ שַׁעַר גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּפְתַּח.
human_translation: took the key, opened the wicket and entered the compartment. from the compartment to the Sanctuary until reach the large gate. he reached the large gate, he moved the bolt and the locks and opened who slaughters would not slaughter until he hear that the large gate opened.
llm_translation: He took the key and opened the lock, and entered the chamber, and from the chamber to the sanctuary, until he reached the Great Gate. When he reached the Great Gate, he removed the bolt and the hinges and opened it. The one who slaughters does not slaughter until he hears the sound of the Great Gate being opened.

hebrew_text: מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל שַׁעַר גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּפְתַּח. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל מַגְרֵיפָה. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל הַשִּׁיר. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל בֶּן אַרְזָה מַקִּישׁ בַּצִּלְצֵל. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל הֶחָלִיל.
human_translation: From Jericho would hear sound that the large gate opened. From Jericho would hear sound a shovel. From Jericho would hear the sound of the song From Jericho would hear the sound of ben Arza clashing the cymbals From Jericho would hear the sound of the flute
llm_translation: From Jericho they would hear the sound of a large gate opening. From Jericho they would hear the sound of a shovel. From Jericho they would hear the sound of singing. From Jericho they would hear the sound of a son of cedar chopping in the forest. From Jericho they would hear the sound of a flute.

hebrew_text: מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל גְּבִינִי כָּרוֹז. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל הָעֵץ שֶׁעָשָׂה בֶּן קָטִין מוּכְנִי לַכִּיּוֹר. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל הַשִּׁיר. מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִין קוֹל הַשּׁוֹפָר. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים אַף קוֹלוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהוּא מַזְכִּיר אֶת הַשֵּׁם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: From Jericho would hear the voice of Gevini crier, From Jericho would hear the sound of the wood that ben Katin crafted a mechanism for the Basin. From Jericho would hear the sound of the song From Jericho would hear the sound of the shofar And some say even the voice of the High Priest at the moment that he mentioned the name on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: From Jericho they would hear the sound of the cheese-maker's proclamation. From Jericho they would hear the sound of the wood that Ben Katin prepared for the altar. From Jericho they would hear the sound of singing. From Jericho they would hear the sound of the shofar. And some say, even the voice of the High Priest when he mentions the Name on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: מִירִיחוֹ הָיוּ מְרֵיחִין רֵיחַ פִּיטּוּם הַקְּטוֹרֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן דִּגְלַאי: עִזִּים הָיוּ לְאַבָּא (בְּעָרֵי) [בְּהָרֵי] הַמִּכְווֹר, וְהָיוּ מִתְעַטְּשׁוֹת מֵרֵיחַ פִּיטּוּם הַקְּטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: From Jericho would smell the fragrance the preparation of the incense Rabbi Elazar ben Diglai said: There were goats to my father in the cities of Mikhvar, and they would sneeze from the fragrance of the preparation of the incense
llm_translation: From Jericho they would smell the fragrance of the incense. Rabbi Elazar ben Diklai said: There were goats belonging to my father in the cities in the mountains of Mechoza, and they would become perfumed from the fragrance of the incense.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּתָּמִיד – מְשָׁכוֹ וְהוֹלֵךְ בְּבֵית הַמִּטְבָּחַיִים. וּמִי שֶׁזָּכוּ בָּאֵבָרִים הוֹלְכִין עִמּוֹ. בֵּית הַמִּטְבָּחַיִים הָיָה לִצְפוֹנוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ, וְעָלָיו שְׁמוֹנָה עַמּוּדִים נַנָּסִים, וּרְבָעִים שֶׁל אֶרֶז עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן, וְאֻנְקְלָאוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל הָיוּ קְבוּעִין בָּהֶן, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה סְדָרִים לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, שֶׁבָּהֶן תּוֹלִין וּמַפְשִׁיטִין עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹת שֶׁל שַׁיִשׁ שֶׁבֵּין הָעַמּוּדִים.
human_translation: who won to the daily offering pulled and go to the slaughterhouse And who won to the limbs go with him. The slaughterhouse was to the north of the altar. Adjacent to it eight low pillars. And cedarwood squares upon them, and iron hooks were fixed in And three rows on each and every one upon which suspend And they flay onto marble tables that between the pillars.
llm_translation: One who merited the daily offering - he would draw and walk in the slaughterhouse. And those who merited the limbs would walk with him. The slaughterhouse was to the north of the altar, and upon it were eight marble pillars, and cedar beams on top of them, and iron hooks were fixed in them, and three rows for each and every one, on which they would hang and skin on marble tables between the pillars.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בְּדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי – נִכְנַס וְנָטַל אֶת הַטְּנִי, וְהִנִּיחוֹ לְפָנָיו, וְהָיָה חוֹפֵן וְנוֹתֵן לְתוֹכוֹ. וּבָאַחֲרוֹנָה, כִּיבֵּד אֶת הַשְּׁאָר לְתוֹכוֹ, וְהִנִּיחוֹ וְיָצָא.
human_translation: who won of the removal of ash from the inner altar entered and took the basket and placed it before him And would take handfuls and place in Ultimately, the priest swept the rest into and placed and emerged
llm_translation: One who merited in the lottery for the inner altar - he would enter and take the shovel, and place it before him, and he would turn it over and put it inside. And in the end, he would weigh the rest inside it, and place it and leave.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בְּדִישּׁוּן הַמְּנוֹרָה, נִכְנַס וּמָצָא שְׁנֵי נֵרוֹת מִזְרָחִית מַעֲרָבִית דּוֹלְקִין – מְדַשֵּׁן אֶת הַשְּׁאָר, וּמַנִּיחַ אֶת אֵלּוּ דּוֹלְקִין בִּמְקוֹמָן. מְצָאָן שֶׁכָּבוּ – מְדַשְּׁנָן וּמַדְלִיקָן מִן הַדּוֹלְקִין, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְדַשֵּׁן אֶת הַשְּׁאָר.
human_translation: who won of the removal of ash from the Candelabrum entered And he found two easternmost lamps western burning, remove the ashes from the rest And leave these burning in their place. he found that were extinguished, remove the ashes them and kindle them from the burning. And afterward, remove the ashes from the rest
llm_translation: One who was privileged to clean the Menorah, he enters and finds two lamps, one facing east and one facing west, burning. He cleans the remaining lamps and places these burning lamps in their place. If he finds them extinguished, he cleans and lights them from the burning lamps, and afterwards cleans the remaining lamps.

hebrew_text: וְאֶבֶן הָיְתָה לִפְנֵי הַמְּנוֹרָה, וּבָהּ שָׁלֹשׁ מַעֲלוֹת שֶׁעָלֶיהָ כֹּהֵן עוֹמֵד וּמֵטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת, (וּמַנִּיחַ) [הִנִּיחַ] אֶת הַכּוּז עַל מַעֲלָה שְׁנִיָּה, וְיָצָא.
human_translation: And there was a stone in front of the Candelabrum and in it there three stairs upon which priest stand and prepare the lamps And place the jug on second stair and emerged
llm_translation: And a stone was before the menorah, and on it three steps, on which the priest stands and arranges the lamps, (and placed) the cup on the second step, and he went out.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה
llm_translation: The honored one will return to you, he said to them, the trusted one.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא הָיוּ כּוֹפְתִין אֶת הַטָּלֶה, אֶלָּא מַעֲקִידִין אוֹתוֹ. מִי שֶׁזָּכוּ בָּאֵבָרִים, אוֹחֲזִין בּוֹ. וְכָךְ הָיָה עֲקֵידָתוֹ: רֹאשׁוֹ לַדָּרוֹם, וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב. וְהַשּׁוֹחֵט עוֹמֵד בַּמִּזְרָח, וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב.
human_translation: would not tie the lamb rather, they would bind it who won to the limbs hold And this was its binding: its head to the south, and its face to the west, And the slaughterer stand to east and his face to the west.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: They did not bend the neck of the lamb, but rather they would position it. If one was found to have a defect in its organs, they would hold it. And this was its positioning: its head facing south, and its face to the west. And the one slaughtering would stand to the east, with his face to the west.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית, עַל טַבַּעַת שְׁנִיָּה. שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, עַל טַבַּעַת שְׁנִיָּיה.
human_translation: of the morning was slaughtered at the northwest corner at second ring. of the afternoon was slaughtered at the northeast corner at second ring.
llm_translation: At dawn, it was slaughtered on the northwestern horn, on its second ring. At twilight, it was slaughtered on the northeastern horn, on its second ring.

hebrew_text: שָׁחַט הַשּׁוֹחֵט, וְקִבֵּל הַמְקַבֵּל, בָּא לוֹ לְקֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, וְנוֹתֵן מִזְרָחָה צָפוֹנָה. מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית, וְנוֹתֵן מַעֲרָבָה דָּרוֹמָה. שְׁיָרֵי הַדָּם הָיָה שׁוֹפֵךְ אֶל יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִית.
human_translation: the slaughterer has slaughtered and the receiver has received comes to northeast corner and places eastern northern southwest and places western southern the remainder of the blood, would pour at southern base
llm_translation: The one who slaughters, and the one who receives, if he comes to the northeast corner, he places it northeastward. If it is the southwest corner, he places it southwestward. The leftover blood he pours at the base of the southwest corner.

hebrew_text: לֹא הָיָה שׁוֹבֵר בּוֹ אֶת הָרֶגֶל, אֶלָּא נוֹקְבוֹ מִתּוֹךְ עַרְקוּבּוֹ, וְתוֹלֶה בּוֹ.
human_translation: he would not break the leg rather, he punctures from within knee and suspends by
llm_translation: He did not break it with the leg, but pierced it from its hollow, and hung it on it.

hebrew_text: הָיָה מַפְשִׁיט וְיוֹרֵד עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לֶחָזֶה. הִגִּיעַ לֶחָזֶה, חָתַךְ אֶת הָרֹאשׁ, וּנְתָנוֹ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בּוֹ. חָתַךְ אֶת הַכְּרָעַיִם, וּנְתָנָן לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהֶן. מֵרַק אֶת הַהֶפְשֵׁט. קָרַע אֶת הַלֵּב וְהוֹצִיא אֶת דָּמוֹ.
human_translation: flaying descending until reach of the breast. he reached the breast, he severed the head and gave it to who won it he severed the legs and gave them to who won them He completed the flaying cut the heart and drained its blood.
llm_translation: He would skin and descend until he reached the chest. When he reached the chest, he would cut off the head, and give it to the one who deserved it. He would cut off the legs, and give them to the one who deserved them. He would clean the entrails. He would tear the heart and extract its blood.

hebrew_text: חָתַךְ אֶת הַיָּדַיִם, וּנְתָנָן לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהֶן. עָלָה לָרֶגֶל הַיְמָנִית, חֲתָכָהּ, וּנְתָנָהּ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהּ, וּשְׁתֵּי בֵּיצִים עִמָּהּ. קְרָעוֹ, וְנִמְצָא כּוּלּוֹ גָּלוּי לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: severed the forelegs and gave them to who won them he moved up to the right leg, severed it, and gave it to who won it and two testicles with tore resulting the entire exposed before him.
llm_translation: He cut the hands, and gave them to the one who won them. He went up to the right foot, cut it, and gave it to the one who won it, along with two eggs. He tore it, and it was found entirely revealed before him.

hebrew_text: נָטַל אֶת הַפֶּדֶר, וּנְתָנוֹ עַל בֵּית שְׁחִיטַת הָרֹאשׁ מִלְּמַעְלָה. נָטַל אֶת הַקְּרָבַיִים, וּנְתָנָן לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהֶן, לַהֲדִיחָן. וְהַכָּרֵס מְדִיחִין אוֹתָהּ בְּבֵית הַמְּדִיחִין. וּמְדִיחִין אוֹתָהּ כׇּל צׇרְכָּהּ, וְהַקְּרָבַיִים מְדִיחִין אוֹתָן שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים בְּמִעוּטָן, עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹת שֶׁל שַׁיִשׁ שֶׁבֵּין הָעַמּוּדִים.
human_translation: He took the fats and placed on the place of slaughter the head above took the innards and gave them to who won them to rinse them And the stomach, rinse it in the rinsing site and they rinsed it as much it required. And the innards, rinse them three times at a minimum, on marble tables that between the pillars
llm_translation: He took the shovel, and placed it on top of the slaughterhouse from above. He took the innards, and gave them to the one who merited them, to rinse them. And the basin they rinse in the washing house. And they rinse it for all its needs, and the innards they rinse them three times in their place, on marble tables between the pillars.

hebrew_text: נָטַל אֶת הַסַּכִּין, וְהִפְרִישׁ אֶת הָרֵיאָה מִן הַכָּבֵד, וְאֶצְבַּע הַכָּבֵד מִן הַכָּבֵד, וְלֹא הָיָה מְזִיזָהּ מִמְּקוֹמָהּ. נוֹקַב אֶת הֶחָזֶה, וּנְתָנוֹ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה.
human_translation: took the knife and separated the lung from the liver, and finger- of the liver, from the liver. And would not move from its place. puncture the breast, and gave it to who won it
llm_translation: He took the knife, and separated the lung from the liver, and the finger of the liver from the liver, and did not move it from its place. He pierced the chest, and gave it to the one who merited it.
