hebrew_text: עָלָה לַדּוֹפֶן הַיְּמָנִית, הָיָה חוֹתֵךְ וְיוֹרֵד עַד הַשִּׁדְרָה, וְלֹא הָיָה נוֹגֵעַ בַּשִּׁדְרָה, עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְבֵין שְׁתֵּי צְלָעוֹת דַּקּוֹת. חֲתָכָהּ, וּנְתָנָהּ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהּ, וְהַכָּבֵד תְּלוּיָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: moved up to the right flank would cut And descending until the spinal column, and would not touch the spinal column, until he reached between the two narrow ribs cut and gave it to who won it And the liver suspended from it.
llm_translation: He ascended to the upper right chamber, he was cutting and descending until the shedra, and he was not touching the shedra until he reaches between two thin ribs. He cut it, and gave it to the one who deserved it, and the heavier one depended on it.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ לַגֵּרָה, הִנִּיחַ בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי צְלָעוֹת מִכָּאן, וּשְׁתֵּי צְלָעוֹת מִכָּאן. חֲתָכָהּ, וּנְתָנָהּ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהּ, הַקָּנֶה וְהַלֵּב וְהָרֵיאָה תְּלוּיִם בָּהּ.
human_translation: came to the cud. He left to it, two ribs from here, and two ribs from there, He cut and gave it to who won it the windpipe, the heart, and the lung suspended from it.
llm_translation: He came to a convert, he placed in her two ribs from here, and two ribs from here. He cut her, and gave her to the one who acquired her, the trachea, the heart, and the lungs depend on her.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ לַדּוֹפֶן הַשְּׂמָאלִית, הִנִּיחַ בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי צְלָעוֹת דַּקּוֹת מִלְּמַעְלָן, וּשְׁתֵּי צְלָעוֹת דַּקּוֹת מִלְּמַטָּן, וְכָךְ הָיָה מַנִּיחַ בַּחֲבֶירְתָּהּ. נִמְצָא מַנִּיחַ שְׁתַּיִם שְׁתַּיִם מִלְּמַעְלָן, שְׁתַּיִם שְׁתַּיִם מִלְּמַטָּן.
human_translation: He came to the left flank left to it two narrow ribs above, and two narrow ribs below, And he did that with its counterpart, resulting two in each above and two in each below.
llm_translation: He came to the left side, placed in it two thin ribs from above, and two thin ribs from below, and thus he would place in its fellow. It was found that he would place two by two from above, two by two from below.

hebrew_text: חֲתָכָהּ וְנָתְנָה לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהּ, וְהַשִּׁדְרָה עִמָּהּ, וְהַטְּחוֹל תָּלוּי בָּהּ, וְהִיא הָיְתָה גְּדוֹלָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁל יָמִין קוֹרִין גְּדוֹלָה – שֶׁהַכָּבֵד תְּלוּיָה בָּהּ. בָּא לוֹ לָעוֹקֶץ, חֲתָכוֹ, וּנְתָנוֹ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בּוֹ. הָאַלְיָה, וְאֶצְבַּע הַכָּבֵד, וּשְׁתֵּי כְּלָיוֹת עִמּוֹ. נָטַל אֶת הָרֶגֶל הַשְּׂמָאלִית, חֲתָכָהּ, וּנְתָנָהּ לְמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בָּהּ. נִמְצְאוּ כּוּלָּן עוֹמְדִים בְּשׁוּרָה, וְהָאֵבָרִים בְּיָדָם.
human_translation: He cut and gave it to who won it and the spinal column with it, and the spleen suspended from it. And was greater, but referred the right greater as the liver was suspended from it. He came to the haunch, cut it, and gave it to who won it the tail, and the finger- of the liver, and the two kidneys with it. He took the left leg, cut it, and gave it to who won it resulted all of standing in line, and the limbs in their hands.
llm_translation: The cutting and giving to the one who is deserving of it, and the spinal cord with it, and the membrane hanging on it, and it was large, but the right side is called large - because the heavy part is hanging on it. If he comes to mock, cut it, and give it to the one who is deserving of it. The tail, and the heavy finger, and two kidneys with it. He took the left leg, cut it, and gave it to the one who is deserving of it. They were all found standing in a row, and the limbs in their hands.

hebrew_text: הָרִאשׁוֹן – בָּרֹאשׁ וּבָרֶגֶל. הָרֹאשׁ בִּימִינוֹ, וְחוֹטְמוֹ כְּלַפֵּי זְרוֹעוֹ, קַרְנָיו בֵּין אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, בֵּית שְׁחִיטָתוֹ מִלְּמַעְלָן, וְהַפֶּדֶר נָתוּן עָלֶיהָ. הָרֶגֶל שֶׁל יָמִין בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, וּבֵית עוֹרָן לַחוּץ. הַשֵּׁנִי – בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם, שֶׁל יָמִין בִּימִינוֹ, וְשֶׁל שְׂמֹאל בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, וּבֵית עוֹרָן לַחוּץ.
human_translation: The first with the head and with the leg the head in his right and its nose toward the arm. Its horns between his fingers, the place of its slaughter above, and the fats were placed upon it, The right leg in his left and side its hide out. The second with two forelegs. right in his right and left in his left and side its hide out.
llm_translation: The first - at the head and at the foot. The head on his right, and his nostril opposite his arm, his horns between his fingers, his windpipe above, and the gullet placed upon it. The foot on his right to his left, and the gullet outside. The second - in both hands, the right on his right, and the left on his left, and the gullet outside.

hebrew_text: הַשְּׁלִישִׁי – בָּעוֹקֶץ וּבָרֶגֶל. הָעוֹקֶץ בִּימִינוֹ, וְהָאַלְיָה מְדוּלְדֶּלֶת בֵּין אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, וְאֶצְבַּע הַכָּבֵד וּשְׁתֵּי כְּלָיוֹת עִמּוֹ. הָרֶגֶל שֶׁל שְׂמֹאל בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, וּבֵית עוֹרָן לַחוּץ. הָרְבִיעִי – בֶּחָזֶה וּבַגֵּרָה. הֶחָזֶה בִּימִינוֹ וְהַגֵּרָה בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, וְצַלְעוֹתָיו בֵּין שְׁנֵי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו. הַחֲמִישִׁי – בִּשְׁתֵּי דְּפָנוֹת, שֶׁל יָמִין בִּימִינוֹ, וְשֶׁל שְׂמֹאל בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, וּבֵית עוֹרָן לַחוּץ. הַשִּׁשִּׁי – בַּקְּרָבַיִם הַנְּתוּנִים בְּבָזֵךְ, וּכְרָעַיִם עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן מִלְּמַעְלָה.
human_translation: The third with the haunch and the leg. the haunch in his right and the tail hanging between his fingers, and the finger- of the liver and the two kidneys with it. the left leg in his left and side its hide out. The fourth with the breast and with the cud, the breast in his right and the cud in his left and its ribs between his two fingers. The fifth with two flanks; right in his right and left in his left and side out. The sixth with the innards, which placed in a vessel, and lower legs atop them from above.
llm_translation: The third - in the thorn and in the foot. The thorn in his right hand, and the aliyah is trembling between his fingers, and the heavy finger and two kidneys with him. The foot of the left in his left, and the house of the navel outside. The fourth - in the chest and in the neck. The chest in his right hand and the neck in his left, and his ribs between his two fingers. The fifth - in the two sides, the right on his right, and the left on his left, and the house of the navel outside. The sixth - in the innards placed in the belly, and the thighs on their backs from above.

hebrew_text: הַשְּׁבִיעִי – בַּסּוֹלֶת. הַשְּׁמִינִי – בַּחֲבִיתִּים. הַתְּשִׁיעִי – בַּיַּיִן. הָלְכוּ וּנְתָנוּם מֵחֲצִי כֶּבֶשׁ וּלְמַטָּה, בְּמַעֲרָבוֹ. וּמְלָחוּם, וְיָרְדוּ וּבָאוּ לָהֶן לְלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית לִקְרוֹת אֶת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: The seventh with the fine flour The eighth with the griddle-cake The ninth with the wine went and placed from halfway the ramp and below, on the west and they salted And they descended and came to the Chamber of Hewn Stone to recite Shema
llm_translation: Seventh - with fine flour. Eighth - with barrels. Ninth - with wine. They would go and place them from half of the ramp and below, in the west. And they would salt them, and they would descend and come to them to the Chamber of Hewn Stone to recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: יָד וָרֶגֶל, כַּעֲקֵידַת יִצְחָק בֶּן אַבְרָהָם.
human_translation: taught foreleg and leg as binding of Isaac, son of Abraham.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: Yad va'regel, ka'akeidat Yitzchak ben Avraham." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Hand and foot, like the binding of Isaac son of Abraham."

hebrew_text: לֹא הָיוּ כּוֹפְתִין אֶת הַטָּלֶה. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, חַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם בִּזְיוֹן קֳדָשִׁים. וְחַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דִּמְהַלֵּךְ בְּחוּקֵּי הָעַמִּים.
human_translation: would not tie the lamb What is the reason Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda. One said: because degradation of sacred items; and one said because that walking in the statutes of the nations,
llm_translation: They did not force the lamb. What is the reason? Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, one said: Because of the degradation of the holy things. And one said: Because it follows the customs of the nations.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵינַיְיהוּ דְּכַפְתֵיהּ בְּשִׁירָאֵי. אִי נָמֵי, בְּהוּצָא דְּדַהֲבָא.
human_translation: What is between between where ties with silk [ beshira’ei ], Alternatively, with a thread of gold.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that one covers it with shira'ei. Alternatively, with the extraction of gold.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שׁוּלְחָנוֹת הָיוּ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. שְׁמוֹנָה שֶׁל שַׁיִשׁ בְּבֵית הַמִּטְבָּחַיִים, שֶׁעֲלֵיהֶם מְדִיחִין אֶת הַקְּרָבַיִם.
human_translation: we learned elsewhere were thirteen tables in the Temple. Eight from marble in the slaughterhouse, where Upon these they would wash the innards
llm_translation: We learned there: Thirteen tables were in the Temple. Eight of marble in the slaughterhouse, upon which they would rinse the innards.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם בַּמַּעֲרָב שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ, אֶחָד שֶׁל שַׁיִשׁ וְאֶחָד שֶׁל כֶּסֶף. עַל שֶׁל שַׁיִשׁ נוֹתְנִין אֶת הָאֵבָרִים, וְעַל שֶׁל כֶּסֶף כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת.
human_translation: two on the western of the ramp, one of marble and one of silver. On of marble place the limbs And on of silver service vessels
llm_translation: Two in the evening of a lamb, one of linen and one of silver. On the one of linen they place the limbs, and on the one of silver the utensils of service.

hebrew_text: וּבָאוּלָם שְׁנַיִם מִבִּפְנִים עַל פֶּתַח הַבַּיִת, אֶחָד שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְאֶחָד שֶׁל זָהָב. עַל שֶׁל כֶּסֶף נוֹתְנִין לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ, וְעַל שֶׁל זָהָב בִּיצִיאָתוֹ.
human_translation: And in the Entrance Hall two on inside, near the opening to the Temple, one of silver and one of gold. On of silver place the shewbread before its entrance And on of gold upon its exit
llm_translation: And they shall come, two from inside, at the entrance of the house, one of silver and one of gold. On the one of silver they shall place the showbread upon its entry, and on the one of gold upon its exit.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמַּעֲלִין בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין. וְאֶחָד שֶׁל זָהָב בִּפְנִים, שֶׁעָלָיו לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים תָּמִיד.
human_translation: as promotes in sanctity and does not demote. And one of gold inside upon which the shewbread always
llm_translation: They ascend in the Holy and do not descend. And one of gold inside, upon which is the showbread continually.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי אֵין עֲנִיּוּת בִּמְקוֹם עֲשִׁירוּת, אַמַּאי עָבְדִי דְּשַׁיִשׁ? נַיעְבְּדוּ דְּכֶסֶף, נַיעְבְּדוּ דְּזָהָב! אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בְּשֵׁם רַבִּי אַסִּי, וְרַבִּי אַסִּי בְּשֵׁם רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְתִּיחַ.
human_translation: Since there no poverty in a place of wealth, fashion of marble? Let them fashion of silver, let them fashion of gold. Rav Ḥinnana says in the name of Rabbi Asi, and Rabbi Asi in the name of Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak: because scalds.
llm_translation: From the fact that there is no poverty in a place of wealth, why did they do that which is unnecessary? They were tested with silver, they were tested with gold! Rav Ḥinnana said in the name of Rabbi Assi, and Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak: Because he is boiling.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״שְׁנַיִם לַיּוֹם״, כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: of the morning was slaughtered at the northwest corner From where are these matters Rav Ḥisda said: As the verse states, two by day, opposite the day.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shel shachar hayah nishchat al keren tzfonit ma'aravit. Menah hanei milei? Amar Rav Chisda: De'amar kra 'shnayim layom', keneged hayom." English translation: "The morning offering was slaughtered on the northwestern horn. From where do we derive these words? Rav Chisda said: As the verse states, 'two each day,' corresponding to the day."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״שְׁנַיִם לַיּוֹם״ – כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹם. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר נֶגֶד הַיּוֹם, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חוֹבַת הַיּוֹם? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֶת הַכֶּבֶשׂ אֶחָד תַּעֲשֶׂה בַבֹּקֶר וְאֵת הַכֶּבֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִי תַּעֲשֶׂה בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״ – הֲרֵי חוֹבַת הַיּוֹם אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״שְׁנַיִם לַיּוֹם״ – נֶגֶד הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: This is also taught “two by day” opposite the day. Do you say opposite the day, or only obligation of day? when states: “One lamb you shall sacrifice in the morning, and the other lamb you shall sacrifice in the afternoon” the obligation of day is stated How, do I realize “two by day”? opposite the day.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of the school of Hillel: "Two per day" - corresponding to the day. Do you say "corresponding to the day," or is it only the obligation of the day? When it says, "You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer between the evenings" - behold, it is speaking of the obligation of the day. So how do I fulfill "two per day" - corresponding to the day.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵיצַד? תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר – הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית, עַל טַבַּעַת שְׁנִיָּה, וְשֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם – הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן צְפוֹנִית מִזְרָחִית, עַל טַבַּעַת שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: How so, daily offering of the morning was slaughtered opposite northwest corner on second ring, And of the afternoon was slaughtered opposite northeast corner on second ring,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: How so? The daily offering of the morning was slaughtered on the north-western horn, on the second ring. And the one of the afternoon was slaughtered on the north-eastern horn, on the second ring.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים שָׁאַל אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן אֶת זִקְנֵי הַנֶּגֶב, אָמַר לָהֶן:
human_translation: Alexander of Macedon asked the Elders of the Negev ten matters. He said to them:
llm_translation: Ten things Alexander Mokdon asked the elders of the Negev, he said to them:

hebrew_text: מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם לָאָרֶץ רָחוֹק, אוֹ מִמִּזְרָח לַמַּעֲרָב? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִמִּזְרָח לַמַּעֲרָב. תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי חַמָּה בַּמִּזְרָח – הַכֹּל מִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ, חַמָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב – הַכֹּל מִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ, חַמָּה בְּאֶמְצַע רָקִיעַ – אֵין הַכֹּל מִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: from the heavens to the earth further, or from east to west They said to him: From east to west Know as sun is in the east, everyone looks at it sun is in the west, everyone looks at it sun is in middle of sky, no one looks at it,
llm_translation: From the sky to the earth, is it far, or from the east to the west? They said to him: from the east to the west. Know that since the sun is in the east - all gaze at it, the sun is in the west - all gaze at it, the sun is in the middle of the sky - not all gaze at it.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה וָזֶה כְּאֶחָד שָׁוִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּגְבוֹהַּ שָׁמַיִם עַל הָאָרֶץ [וְגוֹ׳] כִּרְחוֹק מִזְרָח מִמַּעֲרָב״. וְאִי חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ נְפִישׁ, נִכְתּוֹב תַּרְוַויְיהוּ כִּי הָהוּא דִּנְפִישׁ! וְאֶלָּא, חַמָּה בְּאֶמְצַע רָקִיעַ מַאי טַעְמָא אֵין הַכֹּל מִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאֵי לְהֶדְיָא, וְלָא כָּסֵי לֵיהּ מִידֵּי.
human_translation: But the Sages say: This and that are equal, as it is stated: “For as the heaven is high above the earth, As far as the east is from the west, And if one of the is greater let write both of like that is greater. But sun in middle of sky, what is the reason no one looks at it? because it stands exposed and nothing covers it,
llm_translation: The sages say: "This and that are equal, as it is stated: 'As the heavens are high above the earth etc. as far as the east is from the west.' And if one of them is greater, it is written that they are equal, for that one is greater! Rather, the sun is in the middle of the sky, why? So that all may gaze upon it - because it is for the benefit, and not hidden from anyone."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: שָׁמַיִם נִבְרְאוּ תְּחִלָּה אוֹ הָאָרֶץ? אָמְרוּ: שָׁמַיִם נִבְרְאוּ תְּחִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: He said to them: heavens created first or the earth They said: heavens were created first, as it is stated: “In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth”
llm_translation: He said to them: "Were the heavens created first or the earth?" They said: "The heavens were created first, as it is stated: 'In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: אוֹר נִבְרָא תְּחִלָּה, אוֹ חֹשֶׁךְ? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִילְּתָא דָּא אֵין לַהּ פָּתַר. וְנֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ חֹשֶׁךְ נִבְרָא תְּחִלָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ וְחֹשֶׁךְ״, וַהֲדַר ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים יְהִי אוֹר וַיְהִי אוֹר״!
human_translation: He said to them: light created first, or darkness They said to him: This matter has no solution, But let them say to him darkness was created first, as it is written: “Now the earth was unformed and void, and darkness and then “And God said: Let there be light. And there was light”
llm_translation: He said to them: Light was created first, or darkness? They said to him: This matter has no solution. And they could say to him: Darkness was created first, as it is written: "And the earth was formless and void, and darkness," and then "And God said, 'Let there be light,' and there was light"!

hebrew_text: סָבְרִי, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי מָה לְמַעְלָה וּמָה לְמַטָּה, מָה לְפָנִים וּמָה לְאָחוֹר.
human_translation: maintained: lest come to ask what above and what is below what was before and what after
llm_translation: The scholars thought, perhaps he will come to inquire what is above and what is below, what is in front and what is behind.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שָׁמַיִם נָמֵי לָא נֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ?! מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבוּר אַקְרַאי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּקָא שָׁיֵיל, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָהָדַר שָׁאֵיל, סָבְרִי לָא נֵימָא לֵיהּ, דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי מָה לְמַעְלָה מָה לְמַטָּה, מָה לְפָנִים וּמָה לְאָחוֹר.
human_translation: If so, heaven as well, they should not said to him. initially assumed: merely incidental he is asking once they saw that he again asked they maintained: Let us not tell him lest come to ask: What above what is below what was before and what after
llm_translation: If so, why were the heavens not mentioned?! Initially, one might have thought that it is a verse in the world that is being asked, but once it is seen that he is asking a question, we should think that it was not said to him, for perhaps he will come to ask what is above, what is below, what is in front, and what is behind.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: אֵידֵין מִתְקְרֵי חַכִּים? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵיזֶהוּ חָכָם – הָרוֹאֶה אֶת הַנּוֹלָד. אָמַר לָהֶם: אֵידֵין מִתְקְרֵי גִּבּוֹר? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵיזֶהוּ גִּבּוֹר – הַכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת יִצְרוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶן: אֵידֵין מִתְקְרֵי עָשִׁיר? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵיזֶהוּ עָשִׁיר – הַשָּׂמֵחַ בְּחֶלְקוֹ.
human_translation: said to Who is called wise? They said to him, Who is wise The one who sees the consequences He said to them: Who is called mighty? They said to him, Who is mighty The one who masters his desire. He said to them: Who is called wealthy? They said to him: Who is wealthy The one who is pleased with his portion
llm_translation: He said to them: When is one called wise? They said to him: Who is wise? One who sees the outcome. He said to them: When is one called strong? They said to him: Who is strong? One who conquers his inclination. He said to them: When is one called rich? They said to him: Who is rich? One who is content with his portion.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהֹן: מָה יַעֲבֵיד אִינִישׁ וְיִחְיֶה? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: יָמִית עַצְמוֹ. מָה יַעֲבֵיד אִינִישׁ וְיָמוּת? יְחַיֶּה אֶת עַצְמוֹ. אֲמַר לְהֹן: מָה יַעֲבֵיד אִינִישׁ וְיִתְקַבֵּל עַל בְּרִיָּיתָא? אֲמַרוּ: יִסְנֵי מַלְכוּ וְשׇׁלְטָן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דִּידִי טָבָא מִדִּידְכוּ, יִרְחַם מַלְכוּ וְשׇׁלְטָן, וַיַּעֲבֵד טֵיבוּ עִם בְּנֵי אִינָשָׁא.
human_translation: He said to them: What must a man do and he will live? They said to him: must kill himself, What must a man do and he will die? They said to him: must keep himself alive, He said to them: What must a man do and he will be accepted by people? They said He must hate the king and the authorities said to them: My is better than yours. must love the king and the authorities, but he must perform beneficial for people.
llm_translation: He said to them: What should a person do to live? They said to him: He should kill himself. What should a person do to die? He should let himself live. He said to them: What should a person do to be accepted by the Creator? They said: He should honor the King and the ruler. He said to them: My way is better than yours, the King and the ruler should have mercy, and he should do good with the children of men.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהֹן: בְּיַמָּא יָאֵי לְמֵידַר, אוֹ בְּיַבִּשְׁתָּא יָאֵי לְמֵידַר? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּיַבִּשְׁתָּא יָאֵי לְמֵידַר, דְּהָא כֹּל נָחוֹתֵי יַמָּא לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהוֹן עַד דְּסָלְקִין לְיַבִּשְׁתָּא.
human_translation: He said to them: better to live at sea, or better to live on dry land? They said to him: better to live on dry land, as all seafarers, their minds are unsettled until they reach the dry land.
llm_translation: He said to them: Should one study by the sea, or should one study in a dry place? They said to him: One should study in a dry place, for all who frequent the sea do not have their minds settled until they come to a dry place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: אֵידֵין מִנְּכוֹן חַכִּים יַתִּיר? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כּוּלָּנָא כַּחֲדָא שָׁוַויִין, דְּהָא כֹּל מִילְּתָא דַּאֲמַרְתְּ לַנָא – בְּחַד פְּתַרְנָא לָךְ. אָמַר לָהֶן: מָה דֵין אַתְרֵיסְתּוּן לְקִבְלִי! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: סִטְנָא נָצַח.
human_translation: He said to them: Who among you is wiser They said to him: We are all equal as every matter that you say to us, we solve for you unanimously. He said to them: What is this you, oppose me? They said to him: the Satan is victorious,
llm_translation: He said to them: Is there any additional wisdom from being prepared? They said to him: We are all equal in that we have all the words you have said - in one solution for you. He said to them: What have you prepared to receive? They said to him: A thorn in the flesh.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהֹן: הָא אֲנָא מְקַטֵּילְנָא יָתְכוֹן בִּגְזֵירַת מַלְכִין! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שׇׁלְטָן בְּיָד מַלְכָּא, וְלָא יָאֵי לְמַלְכָּא כָּזָב. מִיָּד אַלְבֵּישׁ יָתְהוֹן לְבוּשִׁין דְּאַרְגְּווֹן, וּשְׁדִי מְנִיכָא דְּדַהֲבָא עַל צַוְּארֵיהוֹן.
human_translation: He said to them: Consequently, I am executing you by the edict of kings. They said to him: authority is in the hand of the king but falsehood is unbecoming for the king, Immediately, dressed them in garments of purple and placed golden chains [ menaykha ] upon their necks.
llm_translation: He said to them: "Behold, I am endangering you with the decree of the kings!" They said to him: "The dominion is in the hand of the king, and the king does not come to falsehood. Immediately they dressed themselves in garments of purple, and placed golden chains around their necks.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהֹן: בָּעֵינָא דְּאֵיזִיל לִמְדִינַת אַפְרִיקֵי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא מָצֵית אָזְלַתְּ, דְּפָסְקִי הָרֵי חשֶׁךְ. אָמַר לְהֹן: לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָא אָזֵילְנָא, אַמְּטוּ הָכִי מְשַׁיֵּילְנָא לְכוּ, אֶלָּא מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד?
human_translation: he said to them: I want to go to the country of Africa [ Afriki ]; They said to him: You will be unable to go as the Mountains of Darkness block He said to them: not possible for me not to go; due this I ask you Rather what I do
llm_translation: He said to them: I want to go to the province of Africa. They said to him: You have not yet gone, for night has fallen. He said to them: It is not a big deal if we have not yet gone, we can still ask them, but what should I do?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי חֲמָרֵי לוּבָאֵי דְּפָרְשִׁי בְּהַבְרָא. וְאַיְיתִי קִיבּוּרֵי דְּמַתְנֵי, וּקְטַר בְּהַאי גִּיסָא, דְּכִי אָתֵית (בְּאוֹרְחָא), נָקְטַתְּ בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ וְאָתֵית לְאַתְרָךְ.
human_translation: They said to him: Bring Libyan donkeys that walk in the darkness [ behavra ], And bring coils of rope, and tie on this side so that when you come by you may take hold of and, you will come back to your place.
llm_translation: They said to him: "Bring the white donkeys that were dispersed in Havra. And bring the burial shrouds of Matnei, and burn them in this reed, for when you come (on the way), take them with you and come to the place."

hebrew_text: עֲבַד הָכִי, וַאֲזַל מְטָא לְהָהוּא מָחוֹזָא דְּכוּלֵּיהּ נְשֵׁי. בָּעֵי לְמִיעְבַּד קְרָבָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי קָטְלַתְּ לַן, יֵאמְרוּ: נְשֵׁי קְטַל. אִי (קָטֵילְנָא) [קָטְלִינַן] לָךְ, יֵאמְרוּ: מַלְכָּא דְּקַטְלוּהּ נְשֵׁי. אֲמַר לָהֶן: אַיְיתוֹ לִי נַהֲמָא. אַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ נַהֲמָא דְּדַהֲבָא אַפָּתוּרָא דְּדַהֲבָא.
human_translation: did this and went He came to a certain town whose entire women, he wanted to wage battle against them. said to him: If you kill us, will say: kills women; if we kill you, will say: king whom women killed said to them: Bring me bread. They brought him bread of gold, upon a table of gold.
llm_translation: The butcher went and came to that city of all women. He wanted to fight with them, they said to him: If you kill us, they will say women killed. If we kill you, they will say the king killed her. He said to them: Bring me a golden sword. They brought him a golden sword.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי אָכְלִי אִינָשֵׁי נַהֲמָא דְּדַהֲבָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא אִי נַהֲמָא בָּעֵית, לָא הֲוָה לָךְ בְּאַתְרָךְ נַהֲמָא לְמֵיכַל, דִּשְׁקַלְתְּ וַאֲתֵית לְהָכָא? כִּי נָפֵיק וְאָתֵי, כְּתַב אַבָּבָא דְּמָחוֹזָא: אֲנָא אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן, הֲוֵיתִי שָׁטְיָיא עַד דַּאֲתֵיתִי לִמְדִינָת אַפְרִיקֵי דִּנְשַׁיָּא, וִילֵיפִית עֵצָה מִן נְשַׁיָּא.
human_translation: said to Do people eat bread of gold? They said to him: But if you wanted bread, didn’t you have bread to eat in your place? that you took and came here. When left and came wrote upon the gate of the town: I, Alexander of Macedon, was a fool until I came to the country of Africa of women, and I learned sense from women.
llm_translation: He said to them: Who ate the bread of the golden table? They said to him: Rather, if you desired bread, you would not have lacked bread in your place to eat, for you took and brought it here? When he went out and came back, Avava of Mahoza wrote: I, Alexander Mokdon, was a sailor until I came to the land of Africa of the women, and I received advice from the women.

hebrew_text: כִּי שָׁקֵיל וְאָתֵי, יָתֵיב אַהָהוּא מַעְיָינָא, קָא אָכֵיל נַהֲמָא. הֲווֹ בִּידֵיהּ גִּלְדָּנֵי דְּמִלְחָא, בַּהֲדֵי דִּמְחַוְּורִי לְהוּ – נְפַל בְּהוּ רֵיחָא. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הַאי עֵינָא מִגַּן עֵדֶן אָתֵי.
human_translation: When he took and went he sat at a certain spring eating bread. He had salted fish [ guldenei ] in his hands, while he cleansed them fragrance fell upon them. said conclude from this spring comes from Garden of Eden.
llm_translation: When he weighed and came, Ahahua sat and was eating bread. He had in his hand a knife of salt, while they were cutting for him - the smell fell upon them. He said: "Hear from this, the eye of the Garden of Eden has come."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: שְׁקַל מֵהָנְהוּ מַיָּא, טְרָא בְּאַפֵּיהּ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אִידַּלִּי כּוּלֵּיהּ עַד דִּמְטָא לְפִתְחָא דְּגַן עֵדֶן, רְמָא קָלָא: פִּתְחוּ לִי בָּבָא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ ״זֶה הַשַּׁעַר לַה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לְהוֹן: אֲנָא נָמֵי מַלְכָּא אֲנָא, מִיחְשָׁב חֲשִׁיבְנָא, הַבוּ לִי מִידֵּי. יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ גּוּלְגֻּלְתָּא חֲדָא, אַתְיַיהּ תַּקְלֵיהּ לְכוּלֵּיהּ דַּהֲבָא וְכַסְפָּא דִּידֵיהּ בַּהֲדַיהּ, לָא הֲוָה (מַתְקָלֵיהּ).
human_translation: There are who say: He took from those waters washed his face. there are who say: He ascended the entire until he reached the entrance of the Garden of Eden. He raised voice, Open the gate for me! said to him: “This is the gate of the Lord; He said to them: I too I am a king; I am very important. give me something They gave him one eyeball. He brought it he weighed all the gold and silver that he had against did not balance
llm_translation: There are some who say: He took water from them, a bull in his mouth. There are some who say: He enlarged all of them until he reached the entrance of the Garden of Eden, he raised his voice: "Open for me the gate!" They said to him, "This is the gate to the Lord." He said to them, "I too am a king, I am considered important, give me from my due." They gave him one skull, he came and placed it on all the gates of gold and silver that were in his hand, it did not fit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוֹן לְרַבָּנַן: מַאי הַאי? אָמְרִי גּוּלְגֻּלְתָּא דְּעֵינָא דְּבִישְׂרָא וּדְמָא [הוּא], דְּלָא קָא שָׂבַע. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִמַּאי דְּהָכִי הוּא? שָׁקְלִי קַלִּיל עַפְרָא וְכַסְּיוּהּ, לְאַלְתַּר תְּקַלָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁאוֹל וַאֲבַדּוֹן לֹא תִשְׂבַּעְנָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: He said to the Sages: What is this? They said: It is the eyeball of flesh and blood, which is not satisfied He said to them: From where that this is Take a small amount of dirt and cover immediately balanced as it is written: “The netherworld and destruction are never satiated;
llm_translation: He said to them, to the sages: What is this? They said: A skull of an eye of a man from Beisra and blood it is, that does not satisfy. He said to them: From what is this? Take a light clod of dirt and cover it, to immediately lighten it, as it is written: "Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied, and so on."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ: גֵּיהִנָּם לְמַעְלָה מִן הָרָקִיעַ, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים לַאֲחוֹרֵי הָרֵי חשֶׁךְ.
human_translation: The school of Eliyahu taught: Gehenna is above the heavens, and some say beyond the Mountains of Darkness.
llm_translation: Mishna of the school of Elijah: Gehinnom is above the firmament, and some say, behind the mountains of darkness.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה בַּלַּיְלָה – שְׁכִינָה כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוּמִי רוֹנִּי בַלַּיְלָה לְרֹאשׁ אַשְׁמוּרוֹת שִׁפְכִי כַמַּיִם לִבֵּךְ נֹכַח פְּנֵי ה׳ (וְגוֹ׳)״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מַרְבִּים שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל בָּנַיִךְ לִמּוּדֵי ה׳ וְרַב שְׁלוֹם בָּנָיִךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: anyone who occupies with Torah at night, the Divine Presence is across from him, as it is stated: “Arise, cry out in the night, at the beginning of the watches; pour out your heart like water before the face of the Lord, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said: Torah scholars increase peace in the world, as it is stated: “And all your children [ banayikh ] shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children”
llm_translation: The Tanna Rabbi Chiya taught: Anyone who engages in Torah study at night - the Divine Presence is with him, as it is stated: "Arise, cry out in the night, at the beginning of the watches; pour out your heart like water before the presence of the Lord" (Lamentations 2:19). Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said: Scholars increase peace in the world, as it is stated: "And all your children shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children" (Isaiah 54:13).

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ לֹא הָיוּ כּוֹפְתִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, they were not forcing.

hebrew_text: א אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה : בָּרְכוּ בְּרָכָה אַחַת! וְהֵם בֵּרְכוּ. קָרְאוּ עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת, ״שְׁמַע״, ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״, ״וַיֹּאמֶר״.
human_translation: The appointed said to Recite a single blessing And recited a blessing, they recited the Ten Commandments, Shema VeHaya im Shamoa VaYomer
llm_translation: He said to them the appointed one: bless with one blessing! And they blessed. They read the Ten Commandments, "Hear," "And it shall come to pass if you diligently obey," "And He said."

hebrew_text: בֵּרְכוּ אֶת הָעָם שָׁלֹשׁ בְּרָכוֹת: ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״, וַעֲבוֹדָה וּבִרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים. וּבַשַּׁבָּת מוֹסִיפִין בְּרָכָה אַחַת לַמִּשְׁמָר הַיּוֹצֵא.
human_translation: they blessed with the people three blessings. True and Firm, and service, and the Priestly Benediction, And on Shabbat, add one blessing by the outgoing priestly watch,
llm_translation: Bless the people three blessings: "True and steadfast," and service and the blessing of the priests. And on Shabbat, we add one blessing for the outgoing watch.

hebrew_text: ב אָמַר לָהֶם: חֲדָשִׁים לִקְטֹרֶת בּוֹאוּ וְהָפִיסוּ. זָכָה מִי שֶׁזָּכָה, אָמַר לָהֶם: חֲדָשִׁים עִם יְשָׁנִים, בּוֹאוּ וְהָפִיסוּ מִי מַעֲלֶה אֵבָרִים מִן הַכֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הַמַּעֲלֶה אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ, הוּא מַעֲלֶה אוֹתָן עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: said to them: new to the incense come and participate in the lottery Whoever won won said to them: new with old come and participate in the lottery who takes the limbs from the ramp, up to the altar. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: who takes the limbs up to the ramp is takes them up upon the altar.
llm_translation: He said to them: "New incense for the offering, come and offer." If one was worthy, he said to them: "New with old, come and offer. Who brings limbs from the sheep to the altar?" Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: "One who brings limbs to the altar, he brings them upon the altar."

hebrew_text: ג מְסָרוּם לַחַזָּנִים, הָיוּ מַפְשִׁיטִין אוֹתָם אֶת בִּגְדֵיהֶם, וְלֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין עֲלֵיהֶם אֶלָּא מִכְנָסַיִם בִּלְבַד. וְחַלּוֹנוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, וְכָתוּב עֲלֵיהֶם תַּשְׁמִישׁ הַכֵּלִים.
human_translation: handed over to the attendants [ laḥazanim ]. would undress their garments, and they would leave only their trousers on them. And there were compartments there and on them was written the use of the garment
llm_translation: Gemara: They handed them over to the chazanim, they would strip off their garments, and they would only put on them trousers alone. And windows were there, and it was written on them "utensils for vessels."

hebrew_text: ד מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּקְּטֹרֶת הָיָה נוֹטֵל אֶת הַכַּף, וְהַכַּף דּוֹמֶה לְתַרְקַב גָּדוֹל שֶׁל זָהָב מַחְזֶקֶת שְׁלֹשָׁה קַבִּין, וְהַבָּזֵךְ הָיָה בְּתוֹכוֹ.
human_translation: who won the incense would take the spoon And the spoon similar to gold vessel held three kav , and the smaller vessel was inside
llm_translation: ד - One who merited the incense would take the spoon, and the spoon resembles a large golden tharqav, strengthening three kav, and the bazeikh was inside it.

hebrew_text: מָלֵא וְגָדוּשׁ קְטֹרֶת, וְכִסּוּי הָיָה לוֹ. וּכְמִין מְטוֹטֶלֶת הָיָה עָלָיו מִלְּמַעְלָן.
human_translation: filled to overflow incense. And it had a cover and there was a type of cloth upon it from above,
llm_translation: Full and piled incense, and covered was for him. And like a kind of shovel was on him from above.

hebrew_text: ה מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּמַּחְתָּה, נָטַל מַחְתַּת הַכֶּסֶף וְעָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וּפִנָּה אֶת הַגֶּחָלִים הֵילָךְ [וְהֵילָךְ], וְחָתָה (מִן הַמְאוּכָּלוֹת הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת). יָרַד וְעֵירָן לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל זָהָב, נִתְפַּזֵּר מִמֶּנּוּ כְּקַב גֶּחָלִים, וְהָיָה מְכַבְּדָן לָאַמָּה.
human_translation: who won to the coal pan took the silver coal pan, ascended to the top of the altar, and cleared to here shoveled He descended and emptied into of gold. Approximately one kav of coals from it was scattered And would sweep into drain
llm_translation: He who merited the shovel, took the silver shovel and ascended to the top of the altar, and turned the coals this way and that way, and removed from the innermost coals. He descended and arranged them in the golden shovel, scattered from it like a handful of coals, and it was an honor for the nation.

hebrew_text: וּבַשַּׁבָּת הָיָה כּוֹפֶה עֲלֵיהֶן פְּסַכְתֵּר. וּפְסַכְתֵּר הָיְתָה כְּלִי גָּדוֹל מַחְזֶקֶת לֶתֶךְ. וּשְׁתֵּי שַׁרְשְׁרוֹת הָיוּ בָּהּ, אַחַת – שֶׁהוּא מוֹשֵׁךְ בָּהּ וְיוֹרֵד. וְאַחַת – שֶׁהוּא אוֹחֵז בָּהּ מִלְּמַעְלָן, בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְגַּלְגֵּל.
human_translation: And on Shabbat, he would overturn a pesakhter upon them. And pesakhter was a large vessel held a half-kor. And there were two chains on it, One which pull down and one that would grasp from above, so that not roll
llm_translation: On Shabbat, he would place a Psachter on them. And the Psachter was a large vessel strengthening the dough. And it had two loops, one - that he would pull with and lower. And one - that he would hold from above, so that it would not roll away.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים הָיְתָה מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת: כּוֹפִין אוֹתָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי גֶּחָלִים, וְעַל הַשֶּׁרֶץ בַּשַּׁבָּת, וּמוֹרִידִין בָּהּ אֶת הַדֶּשֶׁן מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: And would serve three purposes: overturn it upon coals and upon the a creeping animal on Shabbat, and take the ashes down from atop the altar in it.
llm_translation: And three things she would serve: they would bend her over burning coals, and on a creeping creature on Shabbat, and they would sprinkle with her the ashes from upon the altar.

hebrew_text: ו הִגִּיעוּ בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ, נָטַל אֶחָד אֶת הַמַּגְרֵפָה וּזְרָקָהּ בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ. אֵין אָדָם שׁוֹמֵעַ קוֹל חֲבֵירוֹ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם מִקּוֹל הַמַּגְרֵפָה.
human_translation: reached between the Entrance Hall and the altar, One took the shovel and threw it between the Entrance Hall and the altar. No person hear the voice of another in Jerusalem, to sound the shovel.
llm_translation: And they reached between the Ulam and the Mizbeach, one took the shovel and threw it between the Ulam and the Mizbeach. No one hears the voice of his fellow in Jerusalem from the sound of the shovel.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים הָיְתָה מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת: כֹּהֵן שֶׁשּׁוֹמֵעַ אֶת קוֹלָהּ, יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים נִכְנָסִים לְהִשְׁתַּחֲווֹת, וְהוּא רָץ וּבָא. וּבֶן לֵוִי שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹמֵעַ אֶת קוֹלָהּ, יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֶחָיו הַלְוִיִּם נִכְנָסִים לְדַבֵּר בַּשִּׁיר, וְהוּא רָץ וּבָא. וְרֹאשׁ הַמַּעֲמָד, הָיָה מַעֲמִיד אֶת הַטְּמֵאִים בְּשַׁעַר הַמִּזְרָח.
human_translation: And would serve three purposes: priest who hears its sound knows that his brethren the priests are entering to prostrate and he run and come And Levite who hears its sound knows that his brethren the Levites are entering to recite the psalm and he run and come And the head of the watch, would position the ritually impure at the eastern gate
llm_translation: Three things she used to serve: A priest who hears her voice, knows that her priestly brothers are entering to prostrate, and he runs and comes. And a Levite who hears her voice, knows that her Levite brothers are entering to speak in song, and he runs and comes. And the head of the standing, used to stand the impure at the eastern gate.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadrin alach amar lahem hamemunah English translation: "We will return to you," he said to them, the trusted one.

hebrew_text: א הֵחֵלּוּ עוֹלִים בְּמַעֲלוֹת הָאוּלָם. מִי שֶׁזָּכוּ בְּדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי וְהַמְּנוֹרָה הָיוּ מַקְדִּימִים לִפְנֵיהֶם. מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בְּדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי – נִכְנַס וְנָטַל אֶת הַטְּנִי, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה וְיָצָא.
human_translation: began ascending stairs of the Entrance Hall. who won of the removal of ash from the inner altar and the Candelabrum would precede them, who won of the removal of ash from the inner altar entered and took the basket And prostrated and emerged
llm_translation: They began to ascend the steps of the hall. One who was successful in the lottery for the inner altar and the menorah would precede them. One who was successful in the lottery for the inner altar would enter, take the censer, offer incense, and depart.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בְּדִישּׁוּן הַמְּנוֹרָה, נִכְנַס וּמָצָא שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת מַעֲרָבִיִּים דּוֹלְקִין. מְדַשֵּׁן אֶת הַמִּזְרָחִי, וּמַנִּיחַ אֶת הַמַּעֲרָבִי דּוֹלֵק. שֶׁמִּמֶּנּוּ הָיָה מַדְלִיק אֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם. מְצָאוֹ שֶׁכָּבָה, מְדַשְּׁנוֹ וּמַדְלִיקוֹ מִמִּזְבַּח הָעוֹלָה. נָטַל אֶת הַכּוּז מִמַּעֲלָה שְׁנִיָּה, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה וְיָצָא.
human_translation: who won of the removal of ash from the Candelabrum entered and found two western lamps, burning, remove the ash from the easternmost But leave burning the west as from he would kindle the Candelabrum in the afternoon. he found that was extinguished, he remove the ashes and kindle it the altar of the burnt offering. took the jug from second stair and prostrated and emerged
llm_translation: One who was privileged with the kindling of the Menorah, entered and found two western lamps burning. He would clean the eastern one, and place the western one to burn. For from it, he would kindle the Menorah between the evenings. If he found it extinguished, he would clean it and kindle it from the Altar of the Burnt Offering. He would take the spoon from above it a second time, bow, and depart.

hebrew_text: ב מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּמַּחְתָּה, צָבַר אֶת הַגֶּחָלִים עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְרִדְדָּן בְּשׁוּלֵי הַמַּחְתָּה, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה וְיָצָא.
human_translation: who won to the coal pan piled the coals on the altar and flattened them, with the bottom of the coal pan. And prostrated and emerged
llm_translation: In one who merited with the pan, he gathered the coals upon the altar, and spread them on the ramp of the pan, and prostrated himself and departed.

hebrew_text: ג מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּקְּטֹרֶת, הָיָה נוֹטֵל אֶת הַבָּזֵךְ מִתּוֹךְ הַכַּף, וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְאוֹהֲבוֹ אוֹ לִקְרוֹבוֹ. נִתְפַּזֵּר מִמֶּנּוּ לְתוֹכוֹ – נוֹתְנוֹ לוֹ בְּחׇפְנָיו. וּמְלַמְּדִים אוֹתוֹ: הֱוֵי זָהִיר שֶׁמָּא תַּתְחִיל מִפָּנֶיךָ, שֶׁלֹּא תִּכָּוֶה.
human_translation: who won to the incense would take the smaller vessel from within the spoon, and give it to his friend or his relative, was scattered from into give to in his handfuls. And teach Be careful, you might begin before you; so you will not be burned
llm_translation: Tractate: Ketubot Text: "G. One who merited with the incense, would take the leftover incense from within the palm, and give it to his friend or relative. If it scattered from within it the palm - he would give it to him in his cupped hands. And they would teach him: Be careful lest you begin from before you, so that you do not extinguish the incense." Translation:

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל מְרַדְּדָן וְיוֹצֵא. לֹא הָיָה הַמַּקְטִיר מַקְטִיר עַד שֶׁהַמְמוּנֶּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הַקְטֵר! וְאִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, הַמְמוּנֶּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, הַקְטֵר״!
human_translation: began flattening it, and emerge burning would not burn the appointed say to him: Burn And if it was the High Priest the appointed say to him My master, High Priest, burn
llm_translation: He began to measure and go out. The one offering incense would not offer incense until the appointed one said to him: "Offer incense!" And if it was the High Priest, the appointed one would say to him: "My master, the High Priest, offer incense!"

hebrew_text: פָּרְשׁוּ הָעָם, וְהִקְטִיר וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה וְיָצָא.
human_translation: the people, left And burned and prostrated and emerged
llm_translation: The people spread out, and he offered up sacrifices and prostrated himself and departed.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הֵחֵלּוּ עוֹלִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, they began to ascend.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל נִכְנָס לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֹת, שְׁלֹשָׁה אוֹחֲזִין בּוֹ: אֶחָד בִּימִינוֹ, וְאֶחָד בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, וְאֶחָד בַּאֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת.
human_translation: On occasions when the High Priest enter to prostrate three hold him One his right and one his left and one onto precious stones
llm_translation: In a time when the High Priest enters to prostrate, three hold him: one on his right, and one on his left, and one with good stones.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן שֶׁשָּׁמַע הַמְמוּנֶּה קוֹל רַגְלָיו שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא, הִגְבִּיהַּ לוֹ אֶת הַפָּרוֹכֶת. נִכְנַס, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה וְיָצָא. נִכְנְסוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים, הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ וְיָצְאוּ.
human_translation: And once the appointed heard sound feet of the High Priest, that emerging lifted the curtain for him, entered and prostrated and emerged his brethren the priests entered, prostrated and emerged
llm_translation: And when he heard the appointed one the sound of the feet of the high priest that he is going out, he raised for him the curtain. He entered, and prostrated and went out. His brothers the priests entered, prostrated and went out.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ וְעָמְדוּ עַל מַעֲלוֹת הָאוּלָם. עָמְדוּ הָרִאשׁוֹנִים לִדְרוֹם אֲחֵיהֶם הַכֹּהֲנִים, וַחֲמִשָּׁה כֵּלִים בְּיָדָם: הַטְּנִי בְּיַד אֶחָד, וְהַכּוּז בְּיַד אֶחָד, וְהַמַּחְתָּה בְּיַד אֶחָד, וְהַבָּזֵךְ בְּיַד אֶחָד, וְכַף וְכִסּוּיוֹ בְּיַד אֶחָד.
human_translation: they came and stood on the stairs the Entrance Hall. The first stood to south their brethren, the priests, And five vessels in their hands: The basket in the hands of one and the jug in the hands of one and the coal pan in the hands of one and the vessel, in the hands of one and spoon and its cover in the hands of one
llm_translation: They came and stood on the steps of the hall. The first ones stood to the south, their brothers the priests, and they had five utensils in their hands: the censer in one hand, and the ladle in one hand, and the firepan in one hand, and the shovel in one hand, and the spoon and its cover in one hand.

hebrew_text: וּבֵרְכוּ אֶת הָעָם בְּרָכָה אַחַת. אֶלָּא שֶׁבַּמְּדִינָה אוֹמְרִים אוֹתָהּ שָׁלֹשׁ בְּרָכוֹת, וּבַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּרָכָה אַחַת. בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים אֶת הַשֵּׁם כִּכְתָבוֹ, וּבַמְּדִינָה בְּכִנּוּיוֹ.
human_translation: and blessed the people, one blessing. but as in the country recite it three blessings, But in the Temple one blessing, In the Temple, would recite the name as it is written, in the country by His appellation,
llm_translation: And bless the people with one blessing. Rather, in the province they say it with three blessings, and in the Temple with one blessing. In the Temple, they would say the Name as it is written, and in the province with its substitute.

hebrew_text: בַּמְּדִינָה – הַכֹּהֲנִים נוֹשְׂאִים אֶת יְדֵיהֶם כְּנֶגֶד כִּתְפֵיהֶם, וּבַמִּקְדָּשׁ – עַל גַּבֵּי רָאשֵׁיהֶן. חוּץ מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁאֵין מַגְבִּיהַּ אֶת יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה מִן הַצִּיץ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַגְבִּיהַּ אֶת יָדָיו לְמַעְלָה מִן הַצִּיץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשָּׂא אַהֲרֹן אֶת יָדָיו אֶל הָעָם וַיְבָרְכֵם״.
human_translation: in the country, the priests lift their hands opposite their shoulders, and in the Temple above their heads. except for High Priest, who does not raise his hands above the frontplate Rabbi Yehuda says: Even High Priest raise his hands above the frontplate as it is stated “And Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them”
llm_translation: In the province - the priests raise their hands up to their shoulders, and in the Temple - above their heads. Except for the High Priest, who does not raise his hands above the forehead plate. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the High Priest raises his hands above the forehead plate, as it is stated: "And Aaron lifted up his hands towards the people and blessed them."

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל רוֹצֶה לְהַקְטִיר, הָיָה עוֹלֶה בַּכֶּבֶשׁ, וְהַסְּגָן בִּימִינוֹ. הִגִּיעַ לְמַחֲצִית הַכֶּבֶשׁ, אָחַז הַסְּגָן בִּימִינוֹ וְהֶעֱלָהוּ.
human_translation: When the High Priest wishes to burn would ascend the ramp and the deputy to his right. reached half the ramp, the Deputy hold his right and take him up
llm_translation: In a time when the High Priest desires to offer incense, he would go up on the ramp, and the deputy would be on his right. When he reached the middle of the ramp, the deputy would take him by his right hand and help him up.

hebrew_text: וְהוֹשִׁיט לוֹ הָרִאשׁוֹן הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, וְסָמַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן, וּזְרָקָן. הוֹשִׁיט הַשֵּׁנִי לָרִאשׁוֹן שְׁתֵּי הַיָּדַיִם, נוֹתְנָן לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְסָמַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן, וּזְרָקָן. נִשְׁמַט הַשֵּׁנִי וְהָלַךְ לוֹ. וְכָךְ הָיוּ מוֹשִׁיטִין לוֹ שְׁאָר כׇּל הָאֵבָרִין, וְהוּא סוֹמֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן וְזוֹרְקָן. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהוּא רוֹצֶה – הוּא סוֹמֵךְ, וַאֲחֵרִים זוֹרְקִין.
human_translation: And the first handed the head and the hind leg and placed his hands upon them and threw them the second handed the two forelegs to the first gave them to the High Priest, placed his hands upon them and threw them the second slipped away and left. And that would hand the rest of all the limbs, and he place his hands upon them and throw them And when he wishes, he places his hands and others throw
llm_translation: The first shall extend the head and the leg to him, and lean on them, and sprinkle them. The second shall extend to the first two hands, give them to the High Priest, and lean on them, and sprinkle them. The second shall release and go. And so they would extend to him all the other organs, and he would lean on them and sprinkle them. And when he desires – he leans, and others sprinkle.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ לְהַקִּיף אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, מֵהֵיכָן הוּא מַתְחִיל – מִקֶּרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית, מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית, מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית. נָתְנוּ לוֹ יַיִן לְנַסֵּךְ.
human_translation: came to circle the altar from where does he begin? from the southeastern corner northeastern northwestern southwestern gave him wine to pour.
llm_translation: He came to encircle the altar, from where does he begin - from the southeastern horn, from the southeastern to the northeastern, from the northeastern to the northwestern, from the northwestern to the southwestern. They gave him wine to pour.

hebrew_text: הַסְּגָן עוֹמֵד עַל הַקֶּרֶן, וְהַסּוּדָרִים בְּיָדוֹ. שְׁנֵי כֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִין עַל שֻׁלְחַן הַחֲלָבִים, וּשְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת בְּיָדָם. תָּקְעוּ וְהֵרִיעוּ וְתָקְעוּ.
human_translation: The Deputy stands at the corner and the cloths in his hand, Two priests stand at the table of the fats, and two trumpets in their hands. sounded a tekia , sounded a terua , and sounded tekia
llm_translation: The deputy stands by the corner, and the siddurim in his hand. Two priests stand by the table of the fats, and two trumpets in their hands. They blew, they shouted, and they blew.

hebrew_text: בָּאוּ וְעָמְדוּ אֵצֶל בֶּן אַרְזָא, אֶחָד מִימִינוֹ וְאֶחָד מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ. שָׁחָה לְנַסֵּךְ, וְהֵנִיף הַסְּגָן בַּסּוּדָרִים, וְהִקִּישׁ בֶּן אַרְזָא בַּצִּלְצָל, וְדִבְּרוּ הַלְוִיִּם בַּשִּׁיר. הִגִּיעוּ לַפֶּרֶק, תָּקְעוּ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲווּ הָעָם. עַל כׇּל פֶּרֶק – תְּקִיעָה, וְעַל כׇּל תְּקִיעָה – הִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה. זֶהוּ סֵדֶר הַתָּמִיד לַעֲבוֹדַת בֵּית אֱלֹהֵינוּ, יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁיִּבָּנֶה בִּמְהֵרָה בְּיָמֵינוּ, אָמֵן.
human_translation: came and stood near ben Arza, one to his right and one to his left. stooped to pour and the Deputy waved the cloths, and ben Arza struck the cymbals, and the Levites recited the psalm reached the section sounded a tekia , and the people prostrated At each section a tekia , and for every tekia a prostration. That is the procedure for the daily offering in the service of the House of our God; may it be will that it will be speedily rebuilt in our day, amen.
llm_translation: They came and stood by Ben Arza, one on his right and one on his left. He poured the libation, and the deputy waved the flagons. Ben Arza struck the cymbal, and the Levites sang in song. They reached the corner, blew the shofar, and the people prostrated themselves. At every corner - a blowing, and at every blowing - a prostration. This is the order of the daily service in the worship of our God. May it be His will that it be rebuilt quickly in our days, amen.

hebrew_text: הַשִּׁיר שֶׁהָיוּ הַלְוִיִּם אוֹמְרִים בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ: בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״לַה׳ הָאָרֶץ וּמְלוֹאָהּ תֵּבֵל וְיוֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ״. בַּשֵּׁנִי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״גָּדוֹל ה׳ וּמְהֻלָּל מְאֹד בְּעִיר אֱלֹהֵינוּ הַר קׇדְשׁוֹ״. בִּשְׁלִישִׁי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״אֱלֹהִים נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת אֵל בְּקֶרֶב אֱלֹהִים יִשְׁפּוֹט״. בָּרְבִיעִי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״אֵל נְקָמוֹת ה׳ אֵל נְקָמוֹת הוֹפִיעַ״. בַּחֲמִישִׁי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״הַרְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִים עוּזֵּנוּ הָרִיעוּ לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״. בַּשִּׁשִּׁי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״ה׳ מָלָךְ גֵּאוּת לָבֵשׁ לָבֵשׁ וְגוֹמֵר״. בַּשַּׁבָּת הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים ״מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר לְיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת״ – מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא, לְיוֹם שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ שַׁבָּת וּמְנוּחָה לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָמִים.
human_translation: psalm that the Levites would recite in the Temple. On the first day they would recite The earth is the Lord’s and all it contains, the world and all who live in it” On the second they would recite Great is the Lord and highly to be praised in the city of God, on His sacred mountain” On the third they would recite God stands in the divine assembly; among the judges He delivers judgment” On the fourth they would recite “O Lord God, to Whom vengeance belongs, God to Whom vengeance belongs, shine forth” On the fifth they would recite Sing for joy to God, our strength; shout aloud to the God of Jacob” On the sixth they would recite “The Lord reigns: He is robed in majesty; the Lord is robed, On Shabbat they would recite “A psalm, a song for Shabbat day” a psalm, a song for the future, for the day that will be entirely Shabbat and rest for everlasting life.
llm_translation: The song that the Levites used to say in the Temple: On the first day they used to say, "The earth is the Lord's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein." On the second day they used to say, "Great is the Lord and greatly praised in the city of our God, the holy mountain." On the third day they used to say, "God stands in the divine assembly; among the divine beings He pronounces judgment." On the fourth day they used to say, "O God of vengeance, Lord, O God of vengeance, shine forth!" On the fifth day they used to say, "Sing praises to God, our strength; shout to the God of Jacob." On the sixth day they used to say, "The Lord reigns, He is clothed in majesty; the Lord is clothed, He is girded with strength." On the Sabbath they used to say, "A psalm, a song for the Sabbath day" - a psalm, a song for the future, for a day that is entirely Sabbath and rest for the life of the world to come.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בִּזְמַן שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת תָּמִיד
llm_translation: We will return to you when the High Priest goes up to the Temple to study the tractate Tamid.
